title: Update socket.io-client to fix security vulnerability
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [x]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [x]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [x]  Design of the fix
 - [x]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [x]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [x]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->

Regular expression denial of service vulnerability https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/4606

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1. `$ cd packages/composer-connector-proxy/`;
2. `$ npm i`;
3. `$ npm audit`.

## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [x] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [x] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [x] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->

I updated `socket.io-client` dependency because the new version already contains the fix.

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->

The steps below shouldn't show any insufficient entropy vulnerability:

1. `$ cd packages/composer-connector-proxy/`;
2. `$ npm i`;
3. `$ npm audit`.

## Automated Tests
<!-- Please describe the automated tests that are put in place to stop this recurring -->

Not applicable. The fix was just a dependency update.

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
<!-- JSDocs, WebSite and answers to Stack Overflow questions are possible documentation sources -->

Not applicable.

title: make readonly flag parameterless
body:
Modify the @readonly decorator to be parameterless

The decorator now exists as `@readonly` on the model file

Tests and API updated with change

title: [0.19.x] Experimental Performance option within runtime
body:
Performance fixes within runtime to enable skipping JSON generation within serializer if a flag is passed, and enabling the use of this flag in TPFs
-Shortcut serialisation process if objects already exist in serializer and flag is passed
-Add new Decorator to model file for transactions to pass flag to serializer
-Remove unrequired validation steps
-Update tests to account for changes
-Update API text and digest

Signed-off-by: nkl199@yahoo.co.uk <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

title: [0.19.x] Experimental cache enableHistorian flag
body: Signed-off-by: Dave Kelsey <d_kelsey@uk.ibm.com>

title: [0.19.x] Experimental ability to disable historian
body: Signed-off-by: Dave Kelsey <d_kelsey@uk.ibm.com>

title: [0.19.x] Performance fixes within runtime:
body:
-Shortcut serialisation process if objects already exist in serializer, by provision of a Proxy object that maintains the state of the Resource and will update a $isDirty flag if the resource is modified
-Remove unrequired validation steps (if resource will arrive pre-validated, or is an internal Resource)
-Update tests to account for changes

Signed-off-by: nkl199@yahoo.co.uk <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

title: update multi-org conn. profile command
body: This PR changes the way of updating the connection profile in a multiple organization tutorial. instead of using `awk` 3 times and then modify the `byfn-network.json` manually, we can make it in one single step using `jq` and `sponge` which will gives the same result in addition to saving time. I didn't know what else should be written in the command documentation so please add enhancements to it if needed or let me know so i can improve it.

title: [master] Explain how CAs are configured for TLS in the connection profile reference
body: I noticed that orderers and peers have additional explanations for how to configure the connection profile when using TLS, but this is not present for Certificate Authorities. This commit adds such info. It also changes a broken link to the Fabric Node SDK to point readers to the closest related page.

title: [master] Correct ssl-target-name-overrides for peers in connection profile reference
body:
Found two typos in in the connection profile reference documentation. Took me ages to figure out what the issue was... 😭

For reference, the error I received when these name overrides were incorrect was
`"Response from attempted peer comms was an error: Error: Failed to connect before the deadline"`
when attempting to install the network.

I've been experiencing a bunch of different TLS-related issues and they're always extremely cryptic.

title: [Master] Fix typo in event docs
body: Fixed a typo `transactionId` -> `eventId`.

title: [Master] Clarify when events are emitted in the docs
body:
The docs in their current state are vague when it comes to when events are emitted. After digging around, I found [the events entry in the Composer Knowledge Wiki](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer-knowledge-wiki/blob/latest/knowledge.md#information_source--events-consumedsubscribed-to-by-applications-emitted-by-tps) and paired with [this diagram explaining the flow of transactions](https://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/release-1.2/arch-deep-dive.html#swimlane), which explain this in more detail.

I've added a couple of sentences to the docs to clarify this to future users.

title: [Master] stop angular generator from failing on a concept
body:
Removed the broken code.
It still won’t support concepts, but at least it won’t fail if the model
has a concept.

Signed-off-by: Dave Kelsey <d_kelsey@uk.ibm.com>

title: [0.19.x] Improvements to connector logging and disconnection
body:
This adds some more logging to the connector and also
a better disconnect implementation.
Also includes setting logging to warning by default for client apps

Signed-off-by: Dave Kelsey <d_kelsey@uk.ibm.com>

title: Composer Wallet Filesystem ReadOnly
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->
I am building a Serverless API (https://github.com/mataide/serverless-hyperledger), but I dont have write permissions on Lambda, so I need to Composer Wallet Filesystem to be readOnly.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Set .composer folder as read-only
2. Do a Network Ping

## Existing issues
- [ ] https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/4020

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
This was done due to work in a serverless system, we dont have write access to composer files, it should be read-only.

title: Add REST Server support for returning transactions
body:
Solves #4245

## Checklist
 - [x]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [x]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [x]  Design of the fix
 - [x]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [x]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [x]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?

## Issue/User story
#4245 - Adding to the REST Server the support for the returning and read-only transactions introduced in #4165 .

## Steps to Reproduce
see #4245

## Design of the fix
> loopback-connector-composer
- Extended method `create()` to return values after submitting transactions
- Added `discoverReturningTransactions()` to retrieve the list of all returning transactions in the business network

> composer-rest-server 
- Added `registerReturningTransactionMethods()` - Register the composer methods for returning transactions on the REST API.
- Added `registerReturningTransactionMethod()` - to register each composer named transaction method as a POST method on the REST API.

## Validation of the fix
Currently using the returning transactions via REST Server in a separate project successfully.

## Tests
Tests added in both packages with 100% coverage, covering multiple scenarios depending on decorators `@returns` and `@commit`

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request

title: Add integration tests for transaction return types and commit flag
body:
#4165, #4224 

- Extend the CLI command `composer transaction submit` so that it prints any return values (#4165)
- HLFv1 connector should defer to `queryChainCode` when `invokeChainCode` called with commit set to false, to avoid sending endorsements to multiple peers (#4224)
- Runtime should serialize resources as relationships where appropriate, to avoid sending back invalid data (#4165)
- Add integration tests that demonstrate return values working by returning a trade receipt from a marble trade, and checking the output of the CLI command above (#4165)
- Add integration tests that demonstrate read-only transaction processor functions by calling a transaction processor function that reads marbles from multiple business networks, and returns them in a single call (#4224)

title: Client implementation for commit flag, add functional tests
body:
#4224 

Provide client implementation for commit flag - either picking up on the `@commit` decorator for a transaction, or via extended API for `submitTransaction`, and add functional tests to ensure that it works as designed.

title: Extend connectors and embedded/web runtime to support commit flag
body:
#4224 

All connectors (embedded, web, hlfv1) need to be extended not to commit when the commit option is specified and the value is false. In addition to this, the PouchDB runtime (used by the embedded and web runtimes) needs to be updated to handle this, because commit is done there rather than on the client side as it is with hlfv1.

Handle return values from client side, add functional tests

Handle return data from transaction processor functions in the Node.js client module, parse them into return values, and return those values to the calling application.

Thank you!

title: Add runtime implementation for return values

- Rewrite a bunch of transaction handling code with `async` / `await`
- Capture return data from transaction processor functions
- If transaction has a `@returns` decorator, ensure the return data is valid, and serialise back to the caller

Client code will follow in subsequent pull request.

title: Add decorator factory and implementation for @returns
Archive validation 3910
body:
This pull request is in relation to issue #3910 as a "community contribution" requested by @mbwhite .  In accordance to [model compatibility standards](https://hyperledger.github.io/composer/latest/reference/model-compatibility), this adds `composer-cli` functionality in the form of `composer archive validate --from some-archive-from.bna --to some-archive-to.bna`.

The code is finished and all "hotspots" have been accounted for, but I was having issues writing proper unit/integration tests.  I am submitting this in hopes that a more knowledgeable tester could assist in completing the test cases for this code.

title: speed up `fromJSON()` serialisation process

Changing to a different standard npm module (npmjs instead of npm-js) gives us a 6% throughput boost for free 👍  (Well, according to 100k hits on the `fromJSON()` method it does )

try catch required as this module likes to throw instead of 'do it's best' ... which might be why it's faster 🤷‍♂️ 

Now includes a map in the model file to hold local types, which helps yield a 13% perf boost

title: remove string serialise aspect from JSON object creation
body:

closes #4208 

Removes the string creation stage and builds a JSON object directly from the Resource object

In combination with PRs #4204 and #4206, the `serialiser.toJSON()` method is exhibiting a 2x speedup 👌

title: Allow decorators to accept types, add decorator factory
body:
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/4165

Allow a decorator to accept a type (identifier), so that you can do nice things like:

```
@returns(org.acme.Foo[])
transaction MyTransaction { }
```

Allow a model manager to be given a set of decorator factories, which can be optionally added to create a specialised decorator (a subclass of Decorator) to add additional functionality or validation.

For example, we can add a decorator processor for `@returns` to the Composer runtime, that ensures only one argument is passed and that one argument is a reference to a valid type - without adding that constraint for all users of the Composer modelling language.

title: Composer CLI classes exported
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->
As discussed [here](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer-contributors?msg=Ha9Ryh99HoXt6GW2e), it could be useful to export the classes that are in the composer-cli package in order to use it in a JS library.
I didn't add any documentation about those available classes but let me know if it would be useful.

With this PR, it will be possible to use this for instance :
``` js
const CardCreate = require('./packages/composer-cli').Card.Create;

let options = {
  file: "conga.card",
  businessNetworkName: "penguin-network",
  connectionProfileFile: "connection.json",
  user: "conga",
  enrollSecret: "supersecret"
};

CardCreate.handler(options);
```

title: Export for CLI classes added

I didn't add any documentation about those available classes but let me know if it would be useful.

With this PR, it will be possible to use this for instance :

const CardCreate = require('./packages/composer-cli').Card.Create;

let options = {
  file: "conga.card",
  businessNetworkName: "penguin-network",
  connectionProfileFile: "connection.json",
  user: "conga",

};

CardCreate.handler(options);

title: introduce registry cache to prevent unnecessary lookups
body:
Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

closes #4076 by introduction of a registry cache within the transaction. Basic rules of the cache:
1) Nobody talks about the cache
2) If required item is not in the cache, a lookup is performed to retrieve, and it is put into the cache
3) If an item is in the cache, that item is used
4) If an item is removed from the data collection, it is removed from the cache
5) If an item is updated in the data collection, it is removed from the cache

title: Fix double parameter for Query in queryanalyzer
body:
## Issue/User story
This PR solves the issue [#3961](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/3961) when multiple parameters are created if two or more query input fields have exactly the same name.

## Design of the fix
The fix get the parameters from the queryanalyzer and removes duplicates before the REST Server will get it.

100% threshold has been reached

body: After the tx has been processed; add the events to the historian record.

title: Initial drop of LoopBack application generator (contributes to #4094)
body:
Initial drop of LoopBack application generator, as per Composer improvement proposal #4094.

Generates a fully functional LoopBack application with LoopBack models and REST APIs for all Composer models in the specified deployed business network or business network archive. Includes integration tests that test the generator, as well as the generated REST APIs.

Work to do in subsequent PRs:
- Finish porting the system model and all related REST APIs from the Composer REST server, preferably in a way that means it's common code between the two components.
- Add generated LoopBack models and REST APIs for all queries.
- Add documentation for using the LoopBack application generator.
- Handle any remaining comments from the Composer improvement proposal, such as model versioning.

title: Reduce jobQueue polling to 500ms
body:
When a ModelFileLoader downloads multiple files, processing the JobQueue introduces a pause of roughly 10 seconds. When using the composer-common dependency in a short-lived node app, such as Cicero CLI, this behaviour is exposed as a 'hang' before the process exits. See: accordproject/cicero#119

## Issue/User story
Fixes https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/4116

## Steps to Reproduce
See https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/4116

## Design of the fix
The value of the timeout can be debated. Also, ideally we would avoid polling altogether but not clear how to do this.

## Issue/User story
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/4108

## Design of the fix

title: extend docker npm deps to include module composer deps
body:
Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

There was a recent build failure due to an npm module not being able to find a composer dependancy.

This PR extends the DOCKER_NPM_MODULES list that is checked before proceeding to include the first layer of module dependancies for each main package required

title: Correct tutorial command - broken by recent build.
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->
Corrected the composer transaction submit in the multi-org tutorial, and also addresses 4 other minor doc nit-picks.

The problem was found through a Rocket Chat interaction 4th June approx 9am BST.

title: swap to arrays for Docker publish in build script
body:
Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

closes #4102 

It seems that the test config didn't match the actual build config and the Docker images are no longer being published. 

This change swaps to:
- using 2 arrays for the docker images
- Traversing one array to check for existence and modifying the second based on a return result

Did someone say 🐧 ?

title: update the code to add the comma, and fix that test that didnt catch it
body:
Signed-off-by: Matthew B White <whitemat@uk.ibm.com>

The test that caught this problem sadly didn't; it was there and is extensive but typo in the test data meant it went by.

Fixes https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/3934

title: enable smart publishing of npm and docker items during release build
body:
Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>
Closes #3986 

- Check for any existing npm modules before publishing, and during publish phase use an augmented list of 'ignore items'
- Check for any existing docker images that already exist, and only publish those that do not already exist. Completely skip publish phase if all docker images exist.

Intentionally left the Playground conditionality out- we can spin the script to the point where playground is published, and a version bump is a trivial manual process that can be performed by anyone.

title: Update stale bot configuration
body:
Removed 'good first issue', 'epic' and 'top10' exempt labels and
fixed broken link in the close comment

Ideally there would not be any exempt labels since 60+14 days of
innactivity is pretty conservative. If issues are going state,
that is an indication that they need more focus, not that they
should be added to an exemption list

Closes #3925

title: Make web runtime use single db
body:
Updated web runtime so that only one db is used.
This fixes the problem of left over databases when local storage is
cleared after a version change

contributes to hyperledger/composer#3873

Signed-off-by: Caroline Church <caroline.church@uk.ibm.com>

title: change references to public key, acl property ref
body:
Playground docs incorrectly refer to public key, should be private key
Changed tests to specify certificate rather than public key
ACL reference incorrectly says you can control access to a property of an asset.

Closes off issues that went stale

Signed-off-by: Dave Kelsey <d_kelsey@uk.ibm.com>

title: Check for and handle listen errors (resolves #4029)
body:
TypeError: Cannot read property 'port' of null #4029

- Add a `ping` method to the connector server for being able to easily test that it is alive.
- Asyncify all the `createServer` methods (playground API, playground).
- Pass a callback into `listen` so we actually catch any errors.
- Add some testy goodness.

title: Playground support for connection delegation
body:
Also fix issue with embedded connector where re-imported identity loses issuer authority.

Signed-off-by: Dave Kelsey <d_kelsey@uk.ibm.com>

title: prevent calling get() and cache resources (#4003)
body:
Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

Closes #4026 

RegistryManager
- add method to determine if a Composer generated type
- if a Composer generated type and not being called by an 'ensure' method, then use a factory to generate the Asset in order to perform an ACL check, retrieve dataCollection using a 'bypass' flag. Cache the resulting Asset (registry)
- if either non-composer, or being called by an `ensure` method, follow the previous route and perform explicit `get` operations on the sysregistry and dataCollection.

DataService
- add flag to `getCollection` to enable optional bypass of explicit `get` for known types

PR comes complete with enhanced unit tests 👍

title: Move to official grpc fix
body:
closes #4021

Signed-off-by: Dave Kelsey <d_kelsey@uk.ibm.com>

title: Fix HA for peers when 1st peer is down, workaround for node-sdk initialize issue
body:
Addresses the inability to create a new connection if the first peer in the CCP channel definition is unavailable introduced by a change in the node-sdk to get the channelconfig from the first peer in the channel definition rather than the orderer.

closes #4017 

Signed-off-by: Dave Kelsey <d_kelsey@uk.ibm.com>

title: Added 1 line warning not to use sudo
body:
Signed-off-by: rthatcher <robert.thatcher@uk.ibm.com>

Added 1 line warning not to use sudo
Too many users still using sudo or su when installing composer, so a reminder added nearer to the npm commands

title: Fix TSLint Errors in Angular Generator
body:
As a part of #3898, #3403, and #3136 which aim to build a test suite for the Angular application, this PR fixes all TSLint errors in the Angular template as a part of issue #4006.  When running `npm run lint`, you will still receive errors, but only for the `.spec.ts` files, which will need to be tended to when tests are written.

This PR contains only syntactical modifications, and does not alter the logic or function of the code in any way.

A large part of the template code could have been fixed by smushing everything into one line when using EJS for loops, but for ease of future development and readability, I have kept these EJS template loops as they were, and included `<%_ _%>` EJS tags to remove white-space in the generated application.

title: More robust sed match if order changes
body:
Signed-off-by: Paul O'M <mahoney@uk.ibm.com>

<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->
the source connection.json used in the BN cards for this tutorial could be in a different order (eg was 'peer, peer, orderer, ca' now 'orderer, peer, peer, ca' in recent micro releases). This will replace regardless of where in the order the stanza is. Its to allow persistent  REST server container to contact the other dockerized Fabric nodes in the network.

Rob T has tried out the changes.

title: Version playground data in browser
body:
Playground no longer prompts users to delete local storage, which
was not optional anyway, and instead stores data keyed by composer
version. This should still ensure that left over data does not cause
problems with the 'Get started' flow, while leaving the possibility
of retreiving old data.

It would be nice for data to persist accross versions, see #1447,
however this is less of an issue if playground is focussed on the
first use experience.

Closes #3873

Signed-off-by: James Taylor <jamest@uk.ibm.com>

title: Enable empty network generation
body:

Enables the generation of template networks that follow the Playground base options:
- empty network
- basic sample network

The user is presented with a final (new) option that enables the conditional generation of one of the above.

PR contains:
- code to achieve optional change, inclusive of 'empty network' resource files
- extended unit tests for both scenarios
- extended integration tests for both scenarios
- a new step method to enable the strict checking of files in a folder

title: Enable generated app to accept REST server URLs for multiple business networks
body:
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/3802

Allow proxy configuration to accept an override for the REST server URL in two environments:

## REST_SERVER_URL

This went in the first drop - a single URL override.

Example:
```
export REST_SERVER_URL=https://dogecorp.com:3000
```

## REST_SERVER_URLS

This is new in this PR - a JSON string containing business network name to URL mappings for multiple business networks - useful for generic deployment scripts. The application knows which business network that it should look for.

Example: 
```
export REST_SERVER_URLS='{
    "basic-sample-network": "https://basic-sample-network.dogecorp.com",
    "vehicle-manufacture-network": "https://vehicle-manufacture-network.simoncorp.com"
}'
```

Attempted solution for [Issue #3757](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/3757)

title: Dropdown in docs does not show the version number of the different version names #3757
body: Simple on page load jQuery Ajax function that calls [GitHub's Public API Release's Endpoint](https://api.github.com/repos/hyperledger/composer/releases), and parses the json response, appending the 4 most recent release (in order of release number). Attempt to resolve [Issue #3757 ](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/3757) .

title: Enable easy Docker and Cloud Foundry deployment of generated Angular app
body:
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/3802

1) Generate a `Dockerfile` that allows you to easily build a Docker image of your generated Angular application, so you can deploy it using Docker.
2) Generate a `manifest.yml` that allows you to easy push the application into Cloud Foundry using `cf push app-name`.
3) Add `app.js` that can be used to start the built application without having to use the Angular CLI, which is development purposes only.
4) Add `package.json` scripts for building the application and publishing it to npmjs.
5) Stop the generator from creating junk, empty directories in the generated application.
6) Make REST server endpoint dynamic by removing it from `configuration.ts` (and removing this file altogether) and instead using the proxy capabilities of `ng serve` and `app.js` to point to the REST server instead. The REST server endpoint can be changed by changing `REST_SERVER_URL` in the environment.

title: Reorder index
body:
The order in which the fields appear in an index has a huge impact on whether that index will get used by a query.  Specifically, indexes can only be used if the query can selects a contiguous range of values from the index.  See comment 3 of this [post](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47470345/couchdb-mango-queries-and-indexes/47578641#47578641). Since a query that contains a sort (order-by) clause will not work at all if a suitable index cannot be found, I have reordered the fields in the generated index so that 'order-by' fields come before others (e.g. in the 'where' clause).

Resolves #3766

title: As a User, having an APIKEY will provide a first level of security while focusing on the development of the business network.
body:
Using an ApiKey to get access to the REST API would help to establish a first layer of security for a development environment. Thus, this won't substitute the actual Authentication process. Rather it can be an optional support for both early-project development and authentication process.

## Issue/User story
[#3763](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/3763) - As a User, having an APIKEY would provide a first level of security while focusing on the development of the business network

Using an APIKEY would help to adopt a easy-to-setup first layer of security to the development of early-stage projects. 
Threads on Rocketchat discussed about passport-local solutions where users are pre-loaded on db to provide a simple security layer over the project. e.g. [Rocketchat Thread](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer?msg=MaXLCfWrPXNgZAj7d)

The idea is to provide this APIKEY layer as a option which can be used either:
- In early-stage development of projects which doesn't need a complete Auth process.
- As an extra layer of security to support Auth and TLS security.

## Design of the fix
An APIKEY can be a feature to control the communication between multiple APIs in the same network. 
To enable an APIKEY on the Composer Rest API we can either:
- Setup an environmental variable `COMPOSER_APIKEY` 
- Add a param `-y APIKEY` via the command line when starting the composer-rest-server.

If APIKEY is enabled, for each call to the REST API Composer will check if the correct APIKEY is passed as `x-api-key` header of the request.

## Validation of the fix
Unit tests have been deployed and run to test all cases related to API-key. 100% coverage threshold has been reached. 

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
Documentation has been added to files:
- `Reference/rest-server`
- `Integrating/getting-started-rest-api`

title: Rearrange travis tasks to optimize test time
body:
A Jenkins build typically takes ~42 minutes, assuming you get all 5 build engines from the start.  By rearranging the 8 tasks so that the longest running ones are launched first, the the total build time can be reduced by approx 10 minutes.

title: change composer cli example to one that works
body:
The command `composer` when invoked with no args returns help text with some examples.  One example is `composer network deploy`, which is no longer relevant.
This PR replaces this with `composer network install`

title: Identity warn when bound participant not found (Issue 3011)
body:
Fix for #3011

- Playground identity page now shows message when it cannot find the participant bound to an identity in the list.
- Playground identity page removes option to 'Use now' an identity it cannot find the participant for.
- CLI list now sets status as BOUND PARTICIPANT NOT FOUND for identities where it cannot find the participant bound to.
- E2e tests in playground cover creating identity, deleting its participant and then checking it has the message.
- Integration tests for CLI checks that list has the correct status when a bound participant is deleted.

<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->
Had @rthatcher , Nikola and @lesleyannjordan test this version !

FYI
In Step 17 - the final paragraph

From L-A: "I think needs reworded. As it implies once the above commands completes both Alice and Bob will have access the business network, then later on it says they need to create new business cards to access the business network".

I suspect it should be more along the lines:

_"Once this command completes, the business network will have been started. Both Alice and Bob will have been granted to access the business network to start to set up the business network, and onboard other participants from their respective organizations. However, both Alice and Bob must first create new business network cards with the certificates that they created in the previous steps and import them into the business network before they can access the business network."_

to become:

_"Once this command completes, the business network will have been started. Both Alice and Bob will have been granted access to the business network and, as administrators, have authority to onboard other participants from their respective organizations. However, both Alice and Bob must first create new business network cards with the certificates (that were created for them in the previous steps) and import the created cards into the card store, before they can access the business network from their respective organisations."_

title: Improve playground package.json editing
body:
Validation errors on the package.json file are now more obvious in
the playground, which is now edited via a 'settings' icon on the
About file

Note: json syntax errors are not currently picked up in the editor
validation so error markers are still not visible in that case

Required for #3241

Signed-off-by: James Taylor <jamest@uk.ibm.com>

title: Rework e2e tests to ensure correct operation of integration tests
body:
Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

closes #3527 
closes #1358

Substantial re-work of e2e tests:
 - moving parts broken out into folders to match
 - move to using ts files through all test specs and utilities
 - removal of binary files (now generating bna files in tmp dir from resources)
 - use of constants file to specify constant/global test items in all tests
 - ensuring that if publish fails, the tests (and consequently the build) fails
 - publishing of composer-playground to verdaccio to enable testing with npm playground with fabric
 - use of pm2 to run verdaccio (start/delete)
 - change of verdaccio port to prevent possible clash with other integration tests and increasing max_body_size to enable composer-playground to be published
 - breaking up of script files to make them more maintainable/understandable
 - removal of unused imports in test specs 
 - change of npm composer-playground protractor test port to be different from the local cli.js test

title: Skip ACL checking of query results if no ACL file is present
body:
Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

Closes #3437 - unnecessary deserialisation of results from a query.

Design of fix:

Inside `engine.queries` perform a `context.getAclManager().getAclFile()` check prior to looping over all objects. If no ACL file is present, short-cut the check; otherwise, proceed with the promise chain check as before.

New unit test added to ensure that if no ACL file is present then the `accessController.check` is not called and that all resources present are returned.

title: Correctly set Composer version in generated apps
body:
Integration tests for the generator are broken.
This is happening because the generator generates apps that have "next" as the Composer version, instead of the Composer version that was used to generate the app.
This doesn't seem desirable, consensus was that we should pin the version.
Do that, add some unit tests to confirm dependencies are being set correctly, get integration tests going again by publishing additional test packages.

title: Use public key instead of certificate as identifier for identities
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [ ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [ ]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [ ]  Design of the fix
 - [ ]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
Business network cards; operationally, what is the process when an identity's certificate expires? #3036

This is an enablement change for #3036.

When using re-enroll in Hyperledger Fabric, the existing public key of the user is sent to the CA and a new certificate is issued. The new certificate does not match the old certificate (due to the new validity period, amongst other things), and so the new certificate no longer matches the identifier of the identity in the identity registry.

This change uses the public key (embedded in the certificate) as the identifier of the identity in the identity registry, which will not change across re-enroll operations, solving the problem above. The new certificate will have the existing private key, which will still match the identifier of the identity in the identity registry.

These changes also introduce common certificate parsing code across all runtimes, and real certificate generation across the embedded and web runtimes (instead of fake certificates being used).

This is a breaking change and will require a version bump to v0.18.0 along with the changes for cloud wallets being delivered by @mbwhite.

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->

4.

Handling an uncaught Playground error when cancelling a transaction

Fix for #3274 .
Added a catch block to handle a previously uncaught error that occurred when cancelling a transaction in Playground.
Included tests to cover this, and also added a test for an uncovered branch of code in the same class.

title: Fix to make businessNetworkConnection check against registry when needed (Issue #3230)
body:
Closes #3230

Updated connections to have a function to mark whether the connection is one which will allow duplicate IDs via the method described in #3230. By default it is set to false, it is set to true for embedded and web connector types. 

Updated businessNetworkConnection to if the above function is true check against the ID registry for a given network for that ID name, preventing the creation of an ID if so.

title: modify generator to enable options to be passed and add integration tests
body:
contributes to #3385 and closes #3306

Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

It was necessary to change the generator to enable passing of parameters through as command line options ... which itself pulled in a new dependancy

Following this change it was possible to add integration tests to drive the new generator, within which we programatically:
- generate bus net over cli
- install busnet
- run busnet tests
- deploy busnet to Fabric
- create assets in deployed bus net
- run sample transaction to update asset
- check the above have occurred correctly through inspection of console output

title: Add unique identifier of identity to card list output (resolves #2666)
body:
As a user, I can link my business network cards to the identity registry #2666 

I'm adding the unique identifier to the output of `composer card list -n cardname`. This results in the following output for a card that has certificates:

```
$ composer card list -n admin@basic-sample-network
userName:            admin
description:         
businessNetworkName: basic-sample-network
identityId:          7fd005e0d139c5f390e9ba3f8497e9c7070f04d8cc01b0a4d72f671f0a0a9edf <-- new!
roles:               none
connectionProfile: 
  name:   hlfv1
  x-type: hlfv1
secretSet:           Secret set
credentialsSet:      Credentials set

Command succeeded
```

This matches the unique identifier in the identity registry:

```
$ composer identity list -c admin@basic-sample-network
✔ List all identities in the business network 
- 
  $class:      org.hyperledger.composer.system.Identity
  identityId:  7fd005e0d139c5f390e9ba3f8497e9c7070f04d8cc01b0a4d72f671f0a0a9edf <-- it matches!
  name:        admin
  issuer:      5c190e9b33a76439b267695599e4af13011540535cf7560b68f323f7fc3bd24e
  certificate: 
    """
      -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
      MIICAjCCAaigAwIBAgIUQRuLRamPfkqNkEOK19jcMFC2aoUwCgYIKoZIzj0EAwIw
      czELMAkGA1UEBhMCVVMxEzARBgNVBAgTCkNhbGlmb3JuaWExFjAUBgNVBAcTDVNh
      biBGcmFuY2lzY28xGTAXBgNVBAoTEG9yZzEuZXhhbXBsZS5jb20xHDAaBgNVBAMT
      E2NhLm9yZzEuZXhhbXBsZS5jb20wHhcNMTgwMjEzMTY0MjAwWhcNMTkwMjEzMTY0
      NzAwWjAhMQ8wDQYDVQQLEwZjbGllbnQxDjAMBgNVBAMTBWFkbWluMFkwEwYHKoZI
      zj0CAQYIKoZIzj0DAQcDQgAEzqtAAiyx79bIz7BjPOI0vmrlGKXKuiSLoM2Pm0ux
      tnjhLNdn0Rajkotk3gLgy8lk9sqgSel7CDfPN7k9kCMm5aNsMGowDgYDVR0PAQH/
      BAQDAgeAMAwGA1UdEwEB/wQCMAAwHQYDVR0OBBYEFOMEmzgn3jHacg8J2fAaWpE4
      Woa9MCsGA1UdIwQkMCKAIBmrZau7BIB9rRLkwKmqpmSecIaOOr0CF6Mi2J5H4aau
      MAoGCCqGSM49BAMCA0gAMEUCIQCaGau6dFmbPmMUrSUyt582L94pO+lUKK65+jQY
      Sy+yugIgZuCUgbLywJY+c5CxoRCO8zhBg1qVQzMNDfV4qt5jDm0=
      -----END CERTIFICATE-----
      
    """
  state:       ACTIVATED
  participant: resource:org.hyperledger.composer.system.NetworkAdmin#admin

Command succeeded
```

Note that the new `Certificate` class in `composer-common` could be used everywhere to reduce duplication of this code and to use the `jsrsasign` library as per the HLFv1 runtime, but that requires quite a bit of rework of the embedded and web connectors that I'll save for another issue.

title: Add getCurrentIdentity to runtime API and ping response (resolves #2850)
body:
Need ability to get an Identity's public key #2850

Add the function `getCurrentIdentity` to the runtime API, which can be called by a transaction processor function to return the current identity. This function returns an instance of `org.hyperledger.composer.system.Identity`, which provides the `certificate` field.

Expose the current identity through the ping response as well, which means it will show up via the JavaScript API (`BusinessNetworkConnection.ping`), the REST API (`/api/system/ping`), and the CLI (`composer network ping`).

title: Ensure .card extension in for exported card files
body:
Resolves #3183

title: Round trip test for playground and CLI against fabric (Issue 3307)
body:
#3307 

New tests added to e2e of playground that run the round tripping scenario used in our manual tests.

# Changes made
- Introduced command e2e:fabric into package.json to run the new tests
- Updated e2e/test.js to monitor for fabric flag and then start fabric, run the new tests and cleanup
- Added fabric helper to handle starting and stopping of fabric and adding PeerAdmin
- Added CLI helper to allow importing and pinging cards
- Added round-trip.spec.ts to contain the new tests
- Updated alert.ts to added SuccessAlert class
- Updated deploy to add entering username and password and extended wait for fabric
- Updated Login to allow importing and exporting of cards
- Added scripts to start fabric and stop and cleanup also
- Introduced fabric folder to hold fabric specific testing things
- Updated playground tests to look for parameter passed into protractor to decide which connection to use
- Updated to run playground tests against fabric and web connection

title: Fix to prevent duplicate identity names (Issue #3230)
body:
#3230 

Update businessnetworkconnection to perform a check against the names identities in the registry to check if an identity with the passed name exists. This is as the ID used to create an identity is different to one that is activated and thus cannot check exists against this ID in web connection.

Added tests to cover the changes made above.

Discourage users from using `composer network deploy`.
Encourage `composer network install` and `composer network start`

title: iss2952 change network deploy to network start

title: Added hf.Registrar.Attributes to register request (Issue 3137)
body:
#3137 

Added the attribute hf.Registrar.Attributes to allow a created identity with permissions to create identity also have permission to add to new identities they are creating the attributes needed to allow that identity to create identities.

Updated integration and functional tests to check that identities can create other identities.

title: Give LoopBack all abstract types without exposing their remote methods (v0.16.x)
body:
Type missing from Swagger leading to bad Java client gen #1055

We currently hide all abstract types from LoopBack, which means that the Swagger document produced by LoopBack is invalid.

Any reference to an abstract type from a concrete type results in Swagger document errors where the concrete type definition has a `$ref` to the abstract type definition which cannot be resolved. Any compliant Swagger parser will choke on this.

title: Give LoopBack all abstract types without exposing their remote methods (v0.17.x)
body:
Type missing from Swagger leading to bad Java client gen #1055

We currently hide all abstract types from LoopBack, which means that the Swagger document produced by LoopBack is invalid.

Any reference to an abstract type from a concrete type results in Swagger document errors where the concrete type definition has a `$ref` to the abstract type definition which cannot be resolved. Any compliant Swagger parser will choke on this.

title: Add quiet option to 'composer card list'
body:
Add quiet option for command `card list`. When this flag is passed the command will return all the card's names, one for each line.

It fixes #3026

Some thoughts:

- When `--quiet` is passed alongside `-n` then quiet is ignored, since the output would be the same as the input `-n`. So, `composer card list -n card@name -q` is the same as  `composer card list -n card@name`. I have not added any information about this since it seems obvious and it would just pollute the help instructions..

- "Command succeeded" now is not printed if the argument `--quiet` is provided.  "Command failed" is still printed in all situations in case of error.

title: Servicability issues
body:
This moves the filtering into the common code, didn't mean to be as big a change as this. 
But by making the filtering work as intended in the common code, it means that the runtimes
can be simpler. Today they currently just use console.log

We have a console.log formatter already. 
  

Resolves issue #2993

If an error occurs during the setCurrentIdentity function revert the identity to the one that was in use when the function was called to prevent situations such as those described in issue #3011 where the identity is not fully set but the user can no longer click around the playground.

title: Master build updates
body: Too many ' in the JSON

title: Master build updates
body:
This PR merges in #3015 that is the port of the build updates that where made for the support of the 4 'types' of build. 

There are the builds for the v0.16.x releases - the 'latest', and 'unstable' builds
There are the builds for the v0.17.x releases - the 'next' and 'next-unstable' builds.

'latest' is the most stable, and should be used for most purposes. 'next' is the upcoming release, (currently a v0.17.x).  

'unstable' (technically this could be written as 'latest-unstable')  are 'next-unstable' are candidate builds for that could become the next 'latest' or 'next' respectively.

### Changes
The changes here are no different from the ones in the v0.16.x in functional terms. But what is different here is that the code has been refactored to reduce duplicate code, and reduce the length of special cased code paths. 

There is a standard set of fns, in the `core.sh` file. This is pretty much the single source of processing of the TRAVIS env variables to work out what type of build this is. 

Also it has some helper functions for exiting the build in a controlled manner.

The special case codepaths, especially for the deploy phases was quite long. This left a large chance for errors to creep in, in code that was seldom executed.  This has been reduced the minimum

title: Change the deploy to to support different playground urls
body:
Replicate similar code to the docs to support the different suffixes for the playground.
Part resolves #2961
```
    # Push to public Bluemix.
    pushd ${DIR}/packages/composer-playground

    if [ "${TRAVIS_BRANCH}" = "master" ]; then
        PLAYGROUND_SUFFIX="-latest"      
        WEB_CFG="'{\"webonly\":true,  \"analyticsID\" : \"UA-91314349-4\"}'"
    elif [ "${TRAVIS_BRANCH}" = "v0.16.x" ]; then
        PLAYGROUND_SUFFIX=""
        WEB_CFG="'{\"webonly\":true,  \"analyticsID\" : \"UA-91314349-3\"}'"      
    fi
    cf login -a https://api.ng.bluemix.net -u ${CF_USERNAME} -p ${CF_PASSWORD} -o ${CF_ORGANIZATION} -s ${CF_SPACE}
    cf push composer-playground${PLAYGROUND_SUFFIX} -c "node cli.js" -i 2 -m 128M --no-start
    cf set-env composer-playground${PLAYGROUND_SUFFIX} CLIENT_ID ${GH_NEXT_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID}
    cf set-env composer-playground${PLAYGROUND_SUFFIX} CLIENT_SECRET ${GH_NEXT_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET}
    cf set-env composer-playground${PLAYGROUND_SUFFIX} COMPOSER_CONFIG ${WEB_CFG}
    cf start composer-playground${PLAYGROUND_SUFFIX} 
    popd
```

title: Added to webpack config the ability to customise the loading screen (Issue 2949)
body:
#2949

The loading screen title and message can now be set using the environment variables COMPOSER_TITLE and COMPOSER_MESSAGE respectively.

Defaults are set to Hyperledger Composer and Prepare to Blockchain so that the page remains as was when these values are not set.

title: Add support for ppc64le
body:
Duktape does not support ppc64le; it assumes that if the architecture is ppc64, then the CPU is big endian. Fine assumption to make prior to ppc64le being a thing, so need to test whether or not the CPU is big endian or little endian.

Change to Composer simply pulls in latest version of my go-duktape fork with the fix in this commit:
https://github.com/sstone1/go-duktape/commit/5e921675f9067e73f9b606798bfe5ee1858ba91c

Changes required in order to support (in the loosest sense of the word) running on ppc64le.

title: Refactor of installing section (2879 and 2880)
body:
This makes a few changes to the Installing section of the docs to further discourage use of the single-line-installer and make the development environment install steps easier to follow.  It also removes some old out of date information and diagrams from those instructions that were lurking around from the pre-card-native days!

- "Try Playground online" tile now explains the browser requirements and links straight to the web playground (rather than another docs page)
- "Installing pre-requisites" is now a separate page with sections for Ubuntu and Mac (previously Mac was a separate page, whilst Ubuntu was at the top of the install instructions)
- "Installing the development environment" has been adjusted to point to the pre-reqs, and re-worded/re-ordered to assume that the user is here to install everything and then learn how to control the environment they've got.
- Descriptions, previews and titles of the Installing pages have been tidied up for accuracy and consistency.
- Pages are re-ordered in the navigation to put installing the dev environment above the single line installer.

This will close #2879 and #2880 .

title: add application/json to the list of types that identity/issue produces
body:
Signed-off-by: andrew-coleman <andrew_coleman@uk.ibm.com>

<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->
The explorer hang is caused by the swagger-ui javacript code in the browser setting the response type in the XHR object to only accept 'blob'.  It throws an error if text comes back (as with an error message) which appears on the browser console, and leaves the 'waiting' indicator spinning indefinitely.

The fix is to configure the swagger-ui for this route to accept 'application/json' in the list ahead of 'application/octet-stream'.

Resolves #2647.

title: phase one of corrections to api reference docs
body:
Changes in this PR that part resolves #2829 

- Samples moving to async/await and removing old style
- @summary is supported, and if not specified the first line of description up to full stop is used as summary
- *Optional (true/false)* on method args is now called *Mandatory (Yes/No)*
- Corrected odd formatting of some methods, as they had embedded HTML.  
(NOTE comments should use Markdown for lists etc)
- Added in more code details in the main overview summary API reference
- Removed 'documentation.js' dependency
- Had to comment out the use of esprima - as it didn't cope with the async/await in new samples.

title: Fix to prevent editing namespace whilst in IllegalModelException causing data loss when navigating away from model file (Issue 2792)
body:
#2792 

Fix adds file validation in updateFile for model files so that IllegalModelException errors are discovered before the file is updated and thus prevent the namespace being changed.

Changes made: 
- Added validateFile to model file section of updateFile
- Removed validateFile from editor-file.component to reduce duplicate calls
- Update tests to cover the above

title: Undo all of the CLI changes for network admins
body:
Undo all of the CLI changes that have been introduced for network admins:

- New magic `networkAdmin.*` options are not documented ANYWHERE, even in the command line help available with `-h`, and the documented options do NOT work.
- Code for those options mixes up `cert` and `certificate` and I'm pretty sure it's broken with regards to the list of options that _should_ work as per #2753.
- Documentation, including the developer tutorial, has not been updated to reflect the renamed `--networkAdminSecret` flag.
- Random `yarg.groups` have snuck in for SOME of the commands, but not ALL.

Also, renamed to uppercase to match open source conventions and other top level markdown files.

title: reduce parsing and getters
body:
Contributes to #2576

- engine.queries was serialising and deserialising the same thing, we can  pass the original instead
- identitymanager was also inefficient, we can speed it up by doing a get and dealing with an exception if it is thrown due to not being there
- no test fixes for engine.queries required, test fixes for identitymanager due to the change in `.get()`

Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

title: Improve super type declaration and instanceOf lookup
body:
ACL rule execution is inefficient #2576 

Super type declaration lookup is not cached, which means we look it up every time we execute an ACL rule. This also slows down the `instanceOf` check, so lets improve those things.

title: Add remove Identity, consistency for importCard, don't log private keys, tie txids in playground
body:
This addresses the following issues
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/2741 consistency for importCard
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/2727 logging of private keys
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/2340 tx ids not tied to fabric for playground
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/2691 remove cached credentials from connector

title: Fix Google Analytics
body:
Fixed so that we now record each page you visit
Made the analytics id be configurable

closes hyperledger/composer#2779

Signed-off-by: Caroline Church <caroline.church@uk.ibm.com>

title: Cache class declaration in resources
body:
ACL rule execution is inefficient #2576 

Class declaration look up for a given `Typed` object is expensive and pointless; the class declaration is always held in memory by the model manager, and we have to look it up before we can create the `Typed` object anyway. Let's pass it in and store a reference to it!

title: remove validation guide from main repository
body:
Closes #2786

Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

title: Filter ACL rules without using promises
body:
ACL rule execution is inefficient #2576

There's a significant amount of asynchronous promise based code in the runtime access controller that isn't actually asynchronous; this can be improved by filtering the list of valid ACL rules in a synchronous manner before checking the predicates of those rules.

Also, we can avoid wasting time on more expensive wildcard tests by storing a flag that says if a model binding actually has a wildcard or not.

title: update fabric version for integration tests, enable web/proxy fvtests
body:
closes #2782

- travis.yaml flag change
- update of fabric version

Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

title: Only format log inserts if required
body:
ACL rule execution is inefficient #2576 

Log formatting occurs **all** the time, regardless of whether or not logging is enabled. This is quite a problem for the ACL code, which quite rightly logs out a lot of information as it processes ACL rules.

Don't be a fool, check the log level y'all.

Due to the pool of 8 x Duktape JavaScript virtual machines that we run, we need to push the log level into the JavaScript virtual machine on every request. Sad times.

Also apparently what we're doing with `arguments` will kill optimisers. Not that Duktape has one, but fixing the code so it's ready for the Node.js runtime.

title: Use fixed version of go-duktape with better setTimeout handling
body:
High memory usage and leak from Composer runtime #2758

The setTimeout code in `go-duktape` sleeps for 1ms when the timeout is set to 0. JavaScript promise frameworks, as well as other code, call setTimeout with 0 in order to queue up work at the end of the current event loop iteration. This means that we have a lot of pointless napping going on when really we want the code to execute ASAP.

title: Force garbage collection at regular intervals
body:
High memory usage and leak from Composer runtime #2758

Force Duktape to perform garbage collections at regular intervals to keep memory utilisation low. Set the default garbage collection interval to 5 seconds, but allow users to override it by specifying `-o gcInterval=30` (an example for setting it to 30 seconds).

Possible/likely performance degradation owing to garbage collection pauses, but the memory saving for a reasonable BNA file this is well worthwhile. Anybody that objects to the performance degradation can override the garbage collection interval as per the instructions above.

title: Use fixed version of go-duktape
body:
High memory usage and leak from Composer runtime #2758 

Use fixed `go-duktape` that fixes:
- Duktape stack leak caused by a bug in the setTimeout code in `go-duktape`.
- Duktape memory leak caused by context tracking code in `go-duktape`, that we are exacerbating by regularly binding new Go functions to JavaScript.

Ensure the build uses the right version of `go-duktape` by adding a check for the correct Git submodule remote URL - whenever we change this, it tends to result in people undoing the change due to merge failures.

Finally, remove broken git diff code that blows up my personal Travis builds - it does nothing useful anyway.

title: Do not collect JavaScript tokens in HLFv1 runtime
body:
High memory usage and leak from Composer runtime #2758

Stop collecting and storing tokens for any JavaScript files that are loaded as part of a business network definition in the HLFv1 runtime. This saves a significant amount of memory for a BNA that contains a lot of JavaScript code.

title: Enable link, google analytics and npm sample store changes via config settings (Issue #2251)
body:
#2251 

Enables the user to specify using npm config set the values used for the footer links to docs, github, tutorials and community as well as the google analytics ID to use and registry for the npm sample networks. Changes to configuration take effect once the area configured is rebuild (playground or playground-api)

## Changes made:
### Composer Playground:
- **package.json** - Config section added to specify the default values for the links in the footer. Users can overwrite these by changing the values in package.json or using the npm config set command.
- **config/webpack-common.js** - Updated to include the GAID configuration value in the metadata and write the configuration from package.json and npm config to src/config/config.json for use in angular.
- **src/index.html** - Made google analytics only be added if configuration value set for GAID before build.
- **src/footer** - Links now hide if no value for that link exists in the config settings. Links direct to URLs set in the config. Uses config service to access config file written to by webpack common.

### Composer Playground API
- **package.json** - Config setction added to specify default values for use when getting the sample networks: search-url, search-query used for getting a list of sample networks and metadata-url, metadata-query for use when getting the metadata of a package by name.
- **routes/npm.js** - Updated getSampleNames to use config search url and query, if no values found it uses the default of npm registry with current querying. Updated extractMetaData to use config values and replace $PACKAGE_NAME in the metadata query with the package name being searched for to allow for query formats that differ to the npm registry version. If no config settings are found for the metadata url and query then the defaults of npm registry are used, the same as before.

## Testing
- Tested manually with firefox browser.
- Performed and updated unit tests locally for changes.

title: add integration test framework using cucumber tests for the CLI
body:
closes #1708 

Cucumber based CLI integration test framework and initial tests for Composer
- Adds a new Travis process
- Inside new process integration tests are run:

  - Stand up local NPM server, and publish required modules for testing to it
  - Globally install modules required for testing from local NPM server
  - Install Fabric (inside docker containers)
  - Run CLI based commands to flex current code in modules working on top of Fabric using cucumber based scenarios to build a multi-org business network, then build and deploy a BNA file

- Base exemplar tests are currently in place, test extensions are required to incorporate all CLI commands

- Incorporates change of systest package name to /composer-tests-functional to represent the test content (changes to travis publish included)

Signed-off-by: Nick Lincoln <nkl199@yahoo.co.uk>

title: Fix to make update button disabled (Issue 2323)
body:
Issue #2323 

Fix to make the update button disabled when switching from test to define when there is nothing to update.

New behaviour:
- If the user has made no changes since last deploy button remain disabled.
- If there is an error in the users work button is disabled.
- If user has made a change but not clicked update when switching back from test update button is enabled.

Code changes:
- Added false next for change of file service on deploy.
- Updated test file for editor component

title: Issue business network cards from the REST server
body:
As a user, I can import existing identities into my REST server wallet #2072

Update the LoopBack connector and REST server such that the issue identity API generates a new business network card. This is instead of an enrolment ID and secret pair, which is very difficult to use for a REST client as they would have to _somehow_ package it up into a business network card themselves.

title: Fix import of business network cards, upgrade Swagger UI
body:
As a user, I can import existing identities into my REST server wallet #2072 

Upgrade to latest LoopBack explorer for latest Swagger UI:
- Needed to support configuration of Swagger tags, so we can change the API category "Card" to "Wallet" in the UI
- Needed to properly support formData parameters to allow file upload in the UI.

Fix the import of business network cards so that certificates/private keys are imported into the wallet, broke with the latest business network card changes.

title: Add business network card support to the REST server
body:
As a user, I can import existing identities into my REST server wallet #2072 

Update the REST server CLI to use business network cards as per the other commands:
`composer-rest-server -c admin@basic-sample-network`

This means the REST server CLI will drop the `-p`, `-n`, `-i`, and `-s` flags.
The `-c certificateFile` flag will change to `-e certificateFile` to avoid a conflict.
Now that the `-p` and `-n` flags are freed up, we can ditch the capital letters used for `-N namespaces` and `-P port`.

The wallet API for multi-user mode is also being converted to use business network cards, and has also been simplified to make it easier to use:
- Multiple wallets per user are gone.
- Need to call `setDefault` is gone - the first business network card added is set as the default.
- Discovery user (specified on CLI) is not stored in the database along with the wallets.

Documentation updates will follow in a subsequent pull request.

title: Fixed param order in invocation of compareResources
body:
Signed-off-by: Luc Desrosiers <ldesrosi@uk.ibm.com>

The cucumber tests rely on a method called compareResource to ensure that the results from a transaction meets the expected results from the cucumber table.

The output provided by the cucumber tests were confusing because in some cases the actual vs expected parameters had been inverted when calling the compareResource function. While it was the expected results that were not properly being parsed it was giving the impression that the actual results were wrong.

title: Story2333 network cli
body:
Within this PR for #2333 

- Updated all the network clis to take a card instead of the collection of the connection profile, network name, enrollid/secret
- Access the card store for these instead - relies on card store semantics for if it doesn't exist etc.
- Remove the old options from the yargs cli specs.

title: Runtime api docs
body:
Main areas of change here

1) javascriptparser.js 
To make this understand the runtime api properly had to do some work to correct how it saw function statements as well as function delcarations. 
This also meant that the `findcomment` logic had to be updated - and this was moved to work on line basis, rather that token position.

1a) As part of this the javascrtip parser had to be updated to understand the difference between @protected and @public. This means that the syntax of the apiref changelog.txt marks protected methods as ~ not +

2) Minor updates to the class template. noteably, that the heading for the methods does not have the parameters. The html id for the headings is autogenerated, and with the full prototype in it, it wasn't possible to correctly link from other parts of the docs. 

3) Linkage from the other parts of the docs works but the link statements need to be of the form {@link module-class[#optionalfn] } For POC have modified some of these. But there are other issues for updating comments and API docs. 

4) Added in a module/class index that lists the modules and short description.
Added links to these at the top of the pages. 

5) That's it.  oh and it fixes #2325

title: Add CONTAINS operator to query language
body:
As a blockchain developer I would like to query a field within an array #1701

Add a new `CONTAINS` operator to perform queries against array values.

1. Check that an array CONTAINS a single value

`WHERE stringArray CONTAINS "stringValue"`

2. Check that an array CONTAINS a set of values

`WHERE stringArray CONTAINS ["stringValue1", "stringValue2", "stringValue3"]`

3. Check that an array of concepts CONTAINS a concept that matches another expression

`WHERE conceptArray CONTAINS (stringValue == "foobar")`

property of the connection profile.

## Issue/User story
A connection profile gets loaded from disk twice in connect call 
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/2398

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1. The issue cannot be repeated. From the code review, it was found that the connection profile gets loaded from disk twice in a single connect request. This is bit expensive computationally.

- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix 
An internal _getConnectionManager call has been designed that accepts the already loaded connect options instead of reading from the disk. A change in connect call has been made to to make use of this new _getConnectionManager

code review

title: Added new option to Factory API
body:
## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
issue1012
The original issue was that the user couldn't use a regex on an asset/participant identifier because the automatic generation of ids was highly unlikely to pass the regex test (e.g. email address).
This then moved into a discussion about what the behaviour of Playground should be when creating new instances. The design team have observed that in many cases, the users' first action is to change the generated ID to something they'd prefer and so the idea now is that the playground should not generate any sample data (even the ID) when a new instance is being created via the 'Add Asset\Participant' buttons. 
The effect of this is that a skeleton object can always be generated now but the user will have to add a valid ID before it can be committed to the blockchain.  Also, since validation is only disabled for the generation of the resource, a regex can now be used to restrict IDs and other fields as desired.

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->
I've hit another bug while testing this which is that clicking the 'Include optional properties' checkbox after you've populated the instance via the codemirror editor, resets all your current changes (so you'll lose the ID you entered) and I'll raise that as a separate issue after this.

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
Added the capability to 'allowEmptyId' field upon creation of an object instance by the factory in the common project. This is so that the Playground UI and other application clients can create new instances which don't have an identifier immediately. 

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->
Manual checks of the Playground UI 

This should probably be checked by @dselman or @sstone1 since it's a change to a couple of classes in composer-common, and by @caroline-church or @nklincoln from the UI team too.

Signed-off-by: Sam Smith <smithsj@uk.ibm.com>

title: only allow a single enrollment per issued identity
body:
This pull request addresses
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/2056

where rather than allowing an issued identity to be enrolled indefinitely it restricts it to a single enrollment and if you lose the crypto material then you cannot automatically re-enroll the user. Basically it will stop the confusion of identity not being registered when a user someone re-enrolls a user they had already bound to a participant and not understand why it doesn’t work as effectively it is a new certificate (admittedly for the same identity) and it would then output a different error message this time from the CA saying cannot enroll.

Signed-off-by: Dave Kelsey <d_kelsey@uk.ibm.com>

title: Issue 1012
body:
## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
issue1012
The original issue was that the user couldn't use a regex on an asset/participant identifier because the automatic generation of ids was highly unlikely to pass the regex test (e.g. email address).
This then moved into a discussion about what the behaviour of Playground should be when creating new instances. The design team have observed that in many cases, the users' first action is to change the generated ID to something they'd prefer and so the idea now is that the playground should not generate any sample data (even the ID) when a new instance is being created via the 'Add Asset\Participant' buttons. 
The effect of this is that a skeleton object can always be generated now but the user will have to add a valid ID before it can be committed to the blockchain.  Also, since validation is only disabled for the generation of the resource, a regex can now be used to restrict IDs and other fields as desired.

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->
I've hit another bug while testing this which is that clicking the 'Include optional properties' checkbox after you've populated the instance via the codemirror editor, resets all your current changes (so you'll lose the ID you entered) and I'll raise that as a separate issue after this.

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
Added the capability to 'allowEmptyId' field upon creation of an object instance by the factory in the common project. This is so that the Playground UI and other application clients can create new instances which don't have an identifier immediately. 

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->
Manual checks of the Playground UI 

This should probably be checked by @dselman or @sstone1 since it's a change to a couple of classes in composer-common, and by @caroline-church or @nklincoln from the UI team too.

title: Bind business network administrators at network deploy/start time
body:
As a network starter, I can bind an initial set of identities to participants at deployment time #670

- Add support for bootstrap transactions in the runtime; a set of transactions that get passed during deploy/start and executed as part of the initial deploy/start transaction. These can be used to add initial participants, and bind/issue identities to those participants.
- Record the initial deploy/start transaction in the historian.
- Fix the reset business network transaction so it does not clear system registries, including the identity registry!
- Stop any identity with admin in the common name of the certificate from having superpowers.
- Expose bootstrap transactions through the administrative API.
- Expose bootstrap transactions through the CLI.
- Add CLI options for easily adding network administrators.

Documentation to follow in a separate PR!

title: solution to issue #1968
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [ y]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [ y]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [y ]  Design of the fix
 - [ y]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [ y]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
Error messages don't include information about what was wrong and from where error was for thrown for example, in case of addition of model files, if same file is added twice, the error message is not informative enough.

https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/1968

## Steps to Reproduce
1. add a model file and then try to add the same file again, the error will be thrown
2. try to delete a non existent model file

## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [ ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)



## Design of the fix
The direct method to read the stack in JS has been deprecated. In order to get the caller filename and line number, the trick is to throw a dummy error, catch the exception, read and parser stack. This solution has been implemented in new file lib/stackcomponents.js

## Validation of the fix
review of the code.

## Automated Tests
1. The testcase has been added to verify the new code in stackcomponents.js
2. The automated tests has been changed to capture new errors thrown from modelmanager.

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
<!-- JSDocs, WebSite and answers to Stack Overflow questions are possible documentation sources -->

title: Allow ACL wildcards at root level (contributes to #670)
body:
As a network starter, I can bind an initial set of identities to participants at deployment time #670

Permit an ACL rule to reference _all_ types in the business network without knowledge of the namespace. I'm introducing this so we can deliver sample ACL rules that work for all business networks without having to force us or users to provide the right namespace in those rules.

Should permit ACL rules such as:

```
rule EverybodyCanReadEverything {
    description: "Allow all participants read access to all resources"
    participant: "org.acme.sample.SampleParticipant"
    operation: READ
    resource: "**"
    action: ALLOW
}
```

All instances of SampleParticipant have READ access to all instances of all types in the business network, including the system types.

title: Add network admin participant (contributes to #670)
body:
As a network starter, I can bind an initial set of identities to participants at deployment time #670

Add a NetworkAdmin participant that we can bind an identity to during deployment if no bootstrap participants are specified. Adding this in ASAP so we can get the ACLs prepared ahead of time.

title: Correctly handle default double values in grammar (resolves #2187)
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [ ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [ ]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [ ]  Design of the fix
 - [ ]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
Asset attributes with a type of Double are unable to have a default value #2187

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1.
2.
3.
4.


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [ ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
Grammar is incorrect and parses the default double value literal into an object that we then call `parseFloat` on - this causes a wild `NaN` to appear. Fix the grammar to parse the default double value literal as a string so we can parse it into the correct type later on.

## Validation of the fix
