title: Fix for LoopbackVisitor (#2193)
body:
LoopbackVisitor fails with infinite recursion for models that contain classes with properties of the same type as the parent class.

## Checklist
 - [ ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [ ]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [ ]  Design of the fix
 - [ ]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
#2193 

## Design of the fix
The visitor now remembers the types that have been visited before (in the parameters of the visitor) and will not visit them if already visited.

## Validation of the fix
Created a unit test using the model from the origin StackOverflow issue.

## Automated Tests
New unit test added with the model that exhibits the issue.

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
None.

The access token field can be made copyable by using `readonly` instead of `disabled`.

title: Move IdCard migration from fromArchive to constructor
body:
This mitigates the impact of version changes for code that uses
the constructor directly, provided the metadata supplied includes
a version property.

Contributes to #2115 

Signed-off-by: Mark S. Lewis <Mark_Lewis@uk.ibm.com>

title: tx id as per fabrics
body: The transaction id has been delegated to each connector - such that the hlfv1 connector use fabric client. The other connectors will return null so the common layer 'fall back option is used. This uses uuid to create a id as previously.

title: Fix network list command
body:
Fixed registry exists to return false rather than throw an error if the registry doesn't exist

contributes to hyperledger/composer#1804

body:
Contributes to #2115 

Signed-off-by: Mark S. Lewis <Mark_Lewis@uk.ibm.com>

title: Minor fixes to problems found for node.js support
body:
These a small fixes found while testing the new node.js support. Only one of execution impact is that setLogLevel from the logging service will return a promise, but the current implementation doesn't so need to have a way to cope with both for now. Once we get rid of the hlfv1 duktape implementation this code can be changed.
Signed-off-by: Dave Kelsey <d_kelsey@uk.ibm.com>

title: Stop everything looks good appearing when its not
body:
Updated do that everything looks good will only show when all good

contributes to hyperledger/composer#1608

title: #2144 - Fixed new line character issue with certs
body: As stated in issue #2144, previously when trying to create an ID card using certificates, if those certificates contained \n they did not work correctly. This issue has been fixed and the creation can now deal with \n within the certificate string.

body:

Please refer to issue #2157

title: Docs scrollbar fix
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

Fix for the invisible scrollbar problem we had!

There are now scrollbars for the content in the docs on the right hand side, the left hand navigation does not need them as it scales independently in the javascript (so scrollbars will change dynamically and be a bit odd). 

Firefox will have both scrollbars as you can't override the defaults. Chrome and Safari will have the above behaviour...not sure about Edge.

@mbwhite please dont worry about raising an issue about this - all sorted in here. 

@nklincoln could you take a quick look, shouldnt take more than a couple of mins to check it works 👍

title: Adding Angular Support for Enums
body:
## Issue/User story
- addresses #1541

## Steps to Reproduce
- to test both cases, simply use the `marbles-network` from the `composer-sample-networks` and adjust the marbles.cto for the asset `Marble`, change the field type of `color` from `MarbleColor` to `MarbleColor[]`
- deploy the network and generate the Angular application (`yo hyperledger-composer`)
- Access frontend: http://localhost:4200 (default) and navigate to the asset `Marble`
- Perform CRUD operations on Marbles - verification:
    - size is displayed as `radio` input, 
    - color as `checkbox`, 
    - edit/update has the correct values preselected, 
    - list shows correct value(s)

## Design of the fix
- First, the index.js needs to add some more field meta data for asset fields using enumerations (or arrays of enumerations).
- Second, the asset template and component file need to render the corresponding elements and react to form changes (selecting a radio button, checking a checkbox).
- Unfortunately I had to break out of the `FormControl` mechanism, because Angular ran into issues with checkboxes (arrays + using the value of the `input type="checkbox"`). Online search didn't reveal a nice workaround (just some hacks), so I handle array fields populated by enumerations (e.g. `MarbleColor[]`) completely different. Radio inputs seem to work out-of-the-box with the standard `FormControl` behaviour.

## Validation of the fix
Steps to reproduce show the general verification of the correct behaviour.

## Automated Tests
No automated tests. Exiting tests for the generator only verify that certain files are generated, not their functionality.

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
Inline documentation (index.js) and asset helper/event-handler API documentation provided.

title: Show access token in REST explorer
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [ ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [ ]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [ ]  Design of the fix
 - [ ]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?

## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
As a user I can protect my REST APIs using authentication and authorization #142
Is it possible to call secured composer APIs from server side(node) #1996

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1.
2.
3.
4.


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [ ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
The final part of epic #142! This pull request adds the access token into the REST explorer for authenticated users. This means that a user can:

1. Authenticate to the REST server in a web browser
2. Use the REST explorer to determine their access token
3. Use their access token with any standard HTTP or REST client

The most important part about 3) is that it allows any program to make authenticated calls to the REST API, which was previously only possible by manually extracting the access token from a cookie in the browser.

![screen shot 2017-08-29 at 21 40 14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7118158/29843289-6717fe9a-8d03-11e7-9085-cb80121023a4.png)

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->

title: Prevent initial identity cards being deleted
body:
It is currently possible to delete every identity card in the playground
and end up with an empty wallet on the login screen. While refreshing
the screen does recreate the initial identity cards created by the
playground automatically, it is a confusing state to get into. This
fix prevents any of the initial identity cards being deleted. It
might be that we want to allow, or even encourage, people to delete
some of those admin cards in the future, however that would currently
leave no way to get them back if required and this seems like a
reasonable way to address the problem for now.

Contributes to #1930

Signed-off-by: James Taylor <jamest@uk.ibm.com>

title: Use file system connection profile store in web only mode
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [ ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to

 - [ ]  Design of the fix

 - [ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?

## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
Using the v0.12.0 playground on safari throws breaking error #1982

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1.
2.
3.
4.


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [ ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
Web connection profiles contain a `networks` object that stores a mapping of business network names to UUIDs. Those UUIDs are the names of PouchDB databases that live in the web browser and store the actual business network data (the world state) for that business network.

Because the web connection profiles contain browser specific data, they are not suitable for sharing across different browsers or even different machines - so we really shouldn't be writing them to the disk via the connector server!

This fix stops the proxy connection profile store from being used at all in the cloud hosted Playground. We don't know why, but socket.io does not work at all when being served from the cloud hosted Playground on Bluemix - might be socket.io, might be something we're doing, might be Bluemix.

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->

<!-- Please describe the automated tests that are put in place to stop this recurring -->

title: Expose connection profile store for connector server via proxy
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [ ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [ ]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [ ]  Design of the fix
 - [ ]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?

## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
Completely fresh playground and empty composer directories, failed to deploy with error #1938

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1.
2.
3.
4.


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [ ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
This is a fix I've been meaning to get in a for a while. Essentially, whilst we currently proxy the connector API over the connector server, we do not proxy the connection profile store API over the connector server. This means that the playground stores connection profiles in BrowserFS, and only creates them on disk when the playground attempts to connect using a connection profile.

This fix introduces a proxy connection profile store which interacts with a real, file system based connection profile store. The playground can use the proxy connection profile store as if it was a normal connection profile store, and the proxy will take care of routing the calls to the real connection profile store running on the connector server.

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->

title: Modify protractor tests to increase reliability
body:
The switch to using npm to host BNAs would appear to be causing unreliability in the protractor test suite, as described/outlined in #1944, this PR:
 - explicit 'scroll-to' prior to click operation
 - provides an explicit check on base sample types
 - provides an explicit check on npm hosted sample types
 - provides an import select via named sample
 - increases tests to include import of all known sample networks

Note: to reduce binding to possible changes in npm samples, the only action checked in the import is that it succeeds - we are not checking installed files at this time

title: Remove specialised historian registry type
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [ ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [ ]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [ ]  Design of the fix
 - [ ]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?

## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
As a user of a business network, I can view a record of all significant business events #55

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1.
2.
3.
4.


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [ ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
We have a major version bump coming this week to introduce identity cards.
This is a good opportunity to clean up some of the debt in the historian (see #55 for details).

- Remove the `Historian` registry type, and make the historian work as per the identity registry. This means that an asset registry named `org.hyperledger.composer.system.HistorianRecord` will be used. This makes the runtime code simpler and the client code simpler. The registry type and ID are not externals, and are only exposed in the query language - it doesn't matter that they are assets - and this improves historian queries as the FROM clause can be dropped.
- Remove system types SystemRegistry, HistorianRegistry, and ResourceId, neither of which are used anywhere.

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->

## Automated Tests
<!-- Please describe the automated tests that are put in place to stop this recurring -->

title: Cannot query transactions from the transaction registry
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [ ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [ ]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [ ]  Design of the fix
 - [ ]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
Unable to query transactions with CQL language #1888 

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1.
2.
3.
4.


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [ ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
There is a single transaction registry in the runtime at the moment, although this will change in pending work to do under issue #55. This transaction registry has a type of "Transaction" and an ID of "default". We are currently trying to query transactions using the registry ID that matches the fully qualified class name instead of "default" - we need to always use "default" when querying transactions, regardless of the type.

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->

<!-- Please describe the automated tests that are put in place to stop this recurring -->

title: LoopBack wallet uses incorrect wallet identity query
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [ ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [ ]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [ ]  Design of the fix
 - [ ]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
Time Elapsing Breaks Wallet Identities #1731
Secure REST server error - The current identity has not been registered #1784
REST and mongodb error #1794

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1.
2.
3.
4.


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [ ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
When REST server security is enabled, the LoopBack connector goes into "multi-user" mode. This means that each authenticated user has their own business network connection, that uses their own identities from their wallet. The LoopBack connector maintains a pool of these connections, and expires them after 5 minutes.

The REST server provides a `Wallet` implementation, `LoopBackWallet` that provides a view into the `WalletIdentity` data source. However, most of the methods in `LoopBackWallet` do not use the LoopBack APIs correctly - the where clause is not specified, and they end up selecting the first `WalletIdentity` the data source returns.

When the LoopBack connector expires a connection from the pool, the next request reconnects, which results in a lookup of the wallet to retrieve the identity. The problem above causes it not to find the identity (which is still there and still valid), so the code attempts to re-enroll - if successful - another identity is added into the wallet, but it's likely not to be bound to a participant in the identity registry.

The fix fixes `LoopBackWallet` such that it uses the LoopBack APIs correctly, and also fixes the unit tests to detect and prevent this problem from occurring in the future.

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->

## Automated Tests
<!-- Please describe the automated tests that are put in place to stop this recurring -->

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
<!-- JSDocs, WebSite and answers to Stack Overflow questions are possible documentation sources -->

title: 1756 - Fix TypeScript Namespace Import Generation
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->
Fixes #1756.  Adds support to the TypeScript Visitor to generate import statements for property types in other namespaces in other generated files.
## Checklist
 - [x]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [x]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [x]  Design of the fix
 - [x]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [x]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [x]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?

## Issue/User story
See #1756.

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1. Create models with references to namespaces in other CTO files.
2. Run `composer generator create`.
3. Inspect/Try to compile the generated TypeScript.

## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
<!-- please include any links to issues here -->
When asking about the issue in Rocket Chat it was [recommended to submit a GitHub Issue](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer?msg=hyCq33PwyZggsE6Y9).

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
The high level design of the fix is to find all non primitive property types within the class declarations, except enums, within a specific model and index them.  Then the namespace imports for the specific model are also indexed and the types that aren't in the current file are added as TypeScript import statements importing the type from the file it is located in.

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->
I've included the before and after generated files along with a diff of one of the files generated.

[BeforeFix.tar.gz](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/files/1199265/BeforeFix.tar.gz)
[AfterFix.tar.gz](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/files/1199267/AfterFix.tar.gz)
[DiffOutput.txt](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/files/1199266/DiffOutput.txt)


## Automated Tests
<!-- Please describe the automated tests that are put in place to stop this recurring -->
Not sure what tests I should create for this, any suggestions are welcome and I will update accordingly.

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
<!-- JSDocs, WebSite and answers to Stack Overflow questions are possible documentation sources -->
Not sure what documentation I should generate, any suggestions are welcome.

title: Import / Deploy separation, and broken BNA importing
body:
This fixes / resolves issues #1543 and #1530 . The "Deploy" button in the import modal is now "Import", and it allows you to import broken archives.

At the moment, only broken archives that throw an "IllegalModelException" can be imported, as the abstract syntax tree is a requirement for a lot of the downstream functionality within the playground. Maybe in the future we can completely decouple them?

Here is what the changes look like in the playground:

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9812458/28828882-0142df1c-76ca-11e7-8647-856621374952.png)

![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9812458/28828887-0807a788-76ca-11e7-942d-895a0d9d0c15.png)

![3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9812458/28828893-0aacb8c0-76ca-11e7-951b-034cabc6a909.png)


This pull request is open for comments and critiques; any input is greatly appreciated!

title: Add TLS support for the REST server
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->
Enable the REST server to use TLS (HTTPS) instead of good ol' HTTP.
Provide a default certificate for ease of use with demos, but add options for providing your own PEM files. Command line options are:

Enable TLS:
`composer-rest-server -p hlfv1 -n basic-sample-network -i admin -s adminpw -t`

Enable TLS with custom certificates:
`composer-rest-server -p hlfv1 -n basic-sample-network -i admin -s adminpw -t -c /tmp/cert.pem -k /tmp/key.pem`

title: IdCard API changes (#1415)
body:
* Removed images (for now)
* Removed TLS certificates as these are in-lined in connection.json
* JSDoc corrections
* Moved some validation out of fromArchive() into constructor
* Added validation for mandatory 'name' field in connection.json
* Added package export for IdCard
* Changed IdCard.getCredentials()
* Renamed IdCard.getBusinessNetwork() to getBusinessNetworkName()
* Renamed IdCard.getConnection() to getConnectionProfile()
* Added IdCard.getEnrollmentCredentials()
* getDescription() and getBusinessNetworkName() always return a String

Signed-off-by: Mark S. Lewis <Mark_Lewis@uk.ibm.com>

title: Fix determinism errors
body:
Fix for:
Identity activation operation is non-determinstic and fails when using endorsement policies #1646 

Changes are:
- Fix AdminConnection and BusinessNetworkConnection so they supply a client generated transaction UUID and timestamp. They were blank, which meant that the runtime code generated them, which was different on different peer nodes!
- Whilst investigating this, it turned out event publishing was also non-deterministic as it was generating a timestamp for each event. Have fixed this so that the timestamp from the transaction is used for all events.
- It is not possible to connect to an event hub for a peer owned by one MSP using an identity from another MSP (e.g. Org1 cannot connect to the event hub on a peer owned by Org2). This makes it very difficult to do any kind of multi-organisation stuff so I've changed the connection profile code to accept peers with only requestURLs or only eventURLs - as long as you specify at least one of each.
- Finally, and most importantly, I have reworked the system tests so that they use a multiple organisation Fabric v1.0 deployment with an endorsement policy - which catches both of the errors fixed by this PR - and will stop them occurring in the future.

title: upgrade devDependency sinon
body:
According to [sinon-as-promised](https://github.com/bendrucker/sinon-as-promised),

> Sinon 2 added resolves and rejects methods and no longer requires this library.

for a cleaner and latest dependency, this commit upgraded sinon to sinon@2.3.8 and along with upgrade of mocha@3.4.2, nyc@11.1.0 and lerna@2.0.0.

Issues caused by sinon upgrade has been fixed within this commit. All sinon-as-promise requirements are removed from related tests.

title: issue #1174 fixes
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [Y]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [Y]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [Y]  Design of the fix
 - [Y]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [x]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
When a model is created then namespaces are defined by user in model file. There is no check in composer to test duplicate namespaces. Issue #1174 

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1.Create a model file with addition of a namespace twice, run command to create archive. The archive will be created without any error or messages
2.
3.
4.


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [#1189 ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)



## Design of the fix
While adding the namespace when model is created, a check has been added whether namespace already exists or not. If exists, an error is thrown otherwise namespace is added. This is a logical point to add this kind of check.

## Validation of the fix
a code review has been done

## Automated Tests
The four tests has been added to confirm that the fix is working. The change is in two functions. Two testcases for each function has been added.

   1. add a namespace for string, then again try to add second one with same namespace. Composer will throw an error "namespace already exists"
   2. add a list of namespaces (with some namespace repeated) for a string, the composer will automatically check for duplicate namespace and throw an error "namespace already exists"

repeat above two cases when namespace is specified as object

title: Stabilise and Activate Protractor tests
body:
Protractor suite required some rather large changes, it was necessary to:
 - Disable listening to background processes in all tests ( browser.waitForAngular(false) )
 - Condition all helpers to include browser.wait() on all interactions due to the above change
 - Switch to using Chai expect

Whilst I was there I added a test for query file import via drag/drop and activated the Travis test suite.

The above has been tested on local Travis builds, with commits expected to break/timeout/fix tests... so the fail and pass criteria have been looked at with regards to expected build failures on Travis.

title: Improve build performance
body:
- Remove install of Docker and Docker Compose which takes AGES and they are already at the latest levels, possibly a result of recent upgrades to the Trusty build environment.
- Remove sudo for pip which spews warnings, and combine into a single pip command.
- Add lerna to npm install, and combine into a single npm command.
- Use lerna bootstrap instead of npm install which massively reduces install time.

It seems that npm install spends a long time doing something, where lerna bootstrap does not. It might be that npm is struggling to deal with the huge number of dependencies that lerna dumps into node_modules? 

I'm in favour of keeping npm install as is (automatically runs lerna bootstrap) as its easier for first time contributors to use, but we don't have to use it in the builds.

title: fix of duplicate namespaces(issue #1174)
body:
## Checklist
 - [Y ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [ Y]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [ Y]  Design of the fix
 - [ Y]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [ Y]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story

When a model is created then namespaces are defined by user in model file. There is no check in composer to test duplicate namespace. Issue #1174 

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1. Create a model file with addition of a namespace twice, run command to create archive. The archive will be created without any error or messages.
2.
3.
4.


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [#1189 ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/1189

## Design of the fix
While adding the namespace when model is created, a check has been added whether namespace already exists or not. If exists, an error is thrown otherwise namespace is added. This is a logical point to add this kind of check.

## Validation of the fix
a code review has been done

## Automated Tests
The four tests has been added to confirm that the fix is working. The change is in two functions. Two testcases for each function has been added. 
1. add a namespace for string, then again try to add second one with same namespace. Composer will throw an error "namespace already exists"
2.add a list of namespaces (with some namespace repeated) for a string, the composer will automatically check for duplicate namespace and throw an error "namespace already exists"

repeat above two cases when namespace is specified as object

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
<!-- JSDocs, WebSite and answers to Stack Overflow questions are possible documentation sources -->

title: Ensure Composer module version is consistent for releases
body:
Instead of having all the Composer module interdependencies use "^<Composer version>", use "<Composer version>" to ensure that the same version of Composer is used throughout.

Avoids installing "0.9.0" of composer-cli and having it install "0.9.2" of composer-admin/composer-client/etc.

Need to use --exact flag for lerna to stop it adding the carats back in.

title: Fix of issue#1174
body:
The problem relates to duplicate namespaces which are not allowed. There are cases when duplicate namespaces were accepted without throwing an error.

## Checklist
 - [x]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [x]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [x]  Design of the fix
 - [x]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [x]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
The duplicate namespaces are not allowed. When a user's model is getting archived , the namespaces should be checked for duplicacy. An appropriate error should be thrown if duplicate namespace exists in model files.  [https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/1174]

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1. create a sample model with *.cto files reusing the namespace
2. run command to archive model and the archive file gets generated without an error
3.
4.


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [ #1189] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->
https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/1189

## Design of the fix
The model manager is responsible for validating, adding the model and later on updating it. Hence, the check for the presence of duplicate namespaces has been added in model manager.

## Validation of the fix
A manual code walk through has been done to ensure the fix to work.

## Automated Tests
Four new automated tests has been created and added. The testcases try to add the duplicate namespaces in various scenarios and the model manager throws error in all these cases.

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
<!-- JSDocs, WebSite and answers to Stack Overflow questions are possible documentation sources -->

title: Issue 1332 - Enable query support in playground.
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->
Enable query support via drag-and-drop and importing from BNAs, required by issue #1332. 

Following a similar code structure to that of adding ACL files, Query files can now be worked on in playground vi import within a BNA or import via file select.

With the addition of being able to work on query files, necessary validation code has been updated and unit/protractor tests written.

## Design of the fix
followed acl pattern to retain consistency 

## Validation of the fix
manual test on local build

title: Allow ACL rules to resolve and navigate relationships
body:
Rework the runtime access controller to permit ACL rules that resolve and navigate relationships.
For example, when writing an ACL rule for an asset, you often want to look at the owner of the asset and make the decision based on some property of the owner.

Here is a daft example:

```
rule R7 {
    description: "The owner of a vehicle can update the vehicle"
    participant(p1): "systest.accesscontrols.SampleParticipant"
    operation: UPDATE
    resource(p2): "systest.accesscontrols.SampleParticipant"
    condition: (p1.asset.owner.firstName === p2.asset.owner.firstName && p1.asset.owner.asset.owner.lastName === p2.asset.owner.asset.owner.lastName)
    action: ALLOW
}
```

The changes require quite a bit of work:

- Repurposing a lot of code from `QueryExecutor` into `Resolver` so that resources can be prepared for lazy resolution.
  - Lazy resolution uses `CallbackRelationship` to callback into the resolver on property access and trigger resolution.
- Updating `Resolver` to create `InvalidRelationship` objects for invalid or missing relationship targets. These do not throw until you try and access a property in the resolved item.
- Rewriting `AccessController` to be asynchronous and use promises, because now resolution may occur in the middle of an ACL check.
- Updating `AccessController` to use the lazy resolution feature of the resolver and re-run the ACL checks until no more resolution is required.

title: Allow ACL rule conditions to call utility functions
body:
Allow an ACL rule condition to call a utility function defined in a script file.

This allows users to define utility functions which perform complex tests on resources without having to cram it into the condition clause of a ACL rule, and also enables unit testing and code coverage of those utility functions.

Example:

```
rule R5 {
    description: "A participant can delete themselves"
    participant(p1): "systest.accesscontrols.SampleParticipant"
    operation: DELETE
    resource(p2): "systest.accesscontrols.SampleParticipant"
    condition: (participantsAreEqual(p1, p2))
    action: ALLOW
}
```

```
/**
 * Test that the specified participants are the same.
 * @param {Resource} participant1 The first participant.
 * @param {Resource} participant2 The second participant.
 * @return {boolean} True if yes, false if no.
 */
function participantsAreEqual(participant1, participant2) {
    return participant1.getIdentifier() === participant2.getIdentifier();
}
```

title: Playground import from npm fails to work for unstable
body:
The npm import from Playground works locally, but fails on unstable Bluemix with this error:

Response with status: 502 Bad Gateway for URL: http://composer-playground-unstable.mybluemix.net/api/getSampleList

The error is occurring as the version is modified by the build to be just `0.9.1-2017...`, along with all the dependencies. There is a substring being used to remove a leading `^`, but that is not present when we bind all the package versions together using `pkgstamp`, and so we try to parse the invalid version `.9.1-2017...` which causes the process to crash.

Made a few changes:

- Run tests with two different Composer versions, one released (0.9.0) one prerelease (0.9.0-2017...)
- Add a network that depends on 0.9.1 to check its excluded correctly
- Remove pkginfo and just grab the version via package.json
- Since there's now double the tests, replaced call count stuff with fail flags

body:
Related to #1446 

Turns out that we were trying to reuse the internal system models when creating the business network for replacement.... this was being rejected on the creation stage as they have reserved namespaces.

failure of this is detected in (pending) protractor tests that uncovered the issue.

## Design of the fix
Filter out system models before use. A nice enhancement could (should?) be the enablement of updating information of a bnd via compose-common changes (enabling metadata updates etc).

title: PR for #796
body:
Change composer-common/Factory API so that:
- An _includeOptionalFields_ option controls whether optional fields are included in generated data.
- Array field values are generated with a single element (rather than three) for _sample_ data generation, and with no values for _empty_ data generation.

Add _Optional Properties_ checkbox to create new resource and submit transaction dialogs.

body:

title: Use PouchDB query support on embedded and web runtimes
body:
- Remove `QueryService` and `queryNative`.
- Remove old system tests around `queryNative`.
- Add `executeQuery` (which is basically `queryNative`) into DataService.
- Use the `pouchdb-find` plugin for PouchDB, which supports Mango queries, to provide query support on both the embedded and web runtimes.
- Add the `assert` library into global scope for transaction processor functions - it makes writing transaction processor side tests a lot easier!
- Add new system tests around query files and the new `buildQuery` and `query` runtime APIs.

Note that the Mango query support in PouchDB has quite a few bugs so we might have to disable queries for the embedded and web runtimes until they can all be resolved.

As a user, I want to perform complex queries when using the embedded runtime #1010
As a user, I want to perform complex queries when using the web runtime #1328

title: Store the registry ID in the persisted resources
body:
It is not possible to query all of the assets in an asset registry using a Mango query string without having to run a regular expression matcher across every single key - which will not scale.

We can perform this activity when listing all of the assets in an asset registry with the GetStateByRange function in the Fabric chaincode as it uses the `startkey` and `endkey` parameters which are specific to views, however this does not seem to be available in Mango queries.

The easiest way to do this is to add new `$registryType` and `$registryID` properties to all persisted resources that can be indexed and easily added to a Mango query to restrict the queries to a specific registry.

title: All but one landing page complete, lots of minor bug fixes.
body:
Issues: 

#1287 #1288 #1316 #1314 

also all landing pages are now autogenerated from the files themselves, this paves the way to have a more responsive table of contents in line with Sam's work.

title: Allow programmatic creation of query objects from SELECT statements
body:
* Add new `buildQuery` API for generating `Query` objects from a select statement string.
* Enable PEG.js generated parser to optionally parse just select statements instead of query files, so that we can parse dynamic query strings for `query('SELECT org.acme.Vehicle')`. This needs to be also enabled via an options flag, so it only applies for the new `buildQuery` API.
* Change query file syntax so query files can be empty, so we can create them to hang dynamically built queries off of.
* Expose select statement text via the AST and APIs - I need this to be able to use as a cache key for the queries.

title: Add Drag and Drop Tests
body:
Added tests for FileDragDropDirective
Removed random console.logs
Updated coverage requirements

title: add auto scroll to selected item in list
body:
An enhancement for #828, enabling automatic scrolling to newly added files as well as scrolling the user selected file to a common location.

The action will also enable tracking of the file in the user workspace if a file name change occurs.

This makes it easier for a user to track files being worked on.

## Design of the fix
Use a directive to modify the scrollTop setting for the nav container based on the selected item in the navigation side bar.

## Validation of the fix
Manual testing on Ubuntu Chrome and Firefox

## Automated Tests
Tests added for component with 100% code coverage

title: fix composer-rest-server server port log when run with -P arg
body: ## Checklist - [ ] A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to - [x] How to recreate the problem without the fix - [x] Design of the fix - [x] How to prove that the fix works - [ ] Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working - [ ] Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers? ## Issue/User story ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Run `composer-rest-server` with `-P` flag for the port 2. Below screen shot shows an example response with `-P 3005` . Log shows `Web server listening at: http://localhost:3000` instead of `http://localhost:3005` as specified. ## Existing issues - [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer) - [ ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues) - [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer) ## Design of the fix Fixed it because when someone gets a wrong log, they may be prompted to visit the url in the logs, instead of what they passed in as a parameter value. ## Validation of the fix It's relevant to where we check if the Port was provided as one of the CLI arguments. I've reset loopback/express' `app.get('url')`, since loopback uses the provided `config.json` by default to set this global `url` property. ## Automated Tests ## What documentation has been provided for this pull request

title: fix model filenames not being set properly when processing package deps
body:
This would lead to missing files & mismatched file contents when a network uses NPM dependencies with model definitions as well as model definitions outside of `node_modules`.

Happy to add a test but encountered some issues setting up the repository locally as `pkgcheck` is still trying to process `composer-ui` (which seems to have been removed).

title: Docs fix jun
body:
- Updates the image for "local playground" to say full name of Hyperledger Fabric
- Fixes a few typos of "Yeoman"

title: enable protractor on main build and enable verbose logging
body:
Flip the switch to enable Protractor tests against composer during Travis builds, element of #863 and solution to #1124

- package.json modified to include protractor in the npm test
- package.json modified to enable only playground units tests to be run via `npm run test:unit`
- Protractor verbosity increased

title: Remove IBM confidential licenses
body:
As found in: Resolve licensing issues discovered by Fossology scan #1220

As an employee of IBM, I can hereby verify that these files are not IBM Confidential source material, and that we are happy for them to be licensed under Apache 2.0 along with the rest of the Composer source code.

So - this PR removes all IBM Confidential license headers from the Composer repository, and replaces the licensing on the relevant files with the Apache 2.0 license.

title: Protractor Test Extensions
body:
Protractor test base extensions for #863.

 - Remove requirement for hosting drivers
 - Complete first test suite (Welcome component)

title: Defect installer lifecyle
body: Updated the single installer so that it can be rerun.

title: Undef conditioning and test support
body: If running sample installation via npm, model files do not have filenames and this will result in import failures. It is necessary to condition for undefined filename values and conditionally use namespaces instead.

title: condition for undef fileNames
body:
If running sample installation via npm, model files do not have filenames and this will result in import failures. It is necessary to condition for null filename values and conditionally use namespaces instead.

This was a defect found against #387 during manual test validation

title: Refactor of Typed.instanceOf
body: Also tweak ModelUtil.isAssignableTo

title: change URL to match desired local build page
body: Update to point to what will be there once unstable docs become stable

title: Ensure setCurrentFile is run for model renames
body: On model rename, set current file was being skipped due to namespace retention. Need to force a setFile via inspecting display name delta - issue on #387 discovered during validation checks

body: Edits to the playground validation instructions

title: Condition for no filename on model file
body:

This was a defect found against #387 during manual test validation script running

title: !!! DO NOT MERGE !!!
body:
Update ACL code to:
- remove property syntax (wasn't fully implemented anyway)
- support .* and .** globs on namespaces
- check type hierarchy for resources (already implemented for
  participants and transactions)
- add aditional validation

!!! DO NOT MERGE !!! Requires minor version bump and sample updates!

/cc @sstone1 progress so far in case anyone desperately needs it before I finish off the samples/testing/etc.

body:
A whole bunch more updates.

Changes to:

- images and diagrams
- links
- structure
- formatting
- html and layout
- navigation and table of contents

title: Enable script and model file rename
body:
Per user story #387, enable the renaming of script and model files following design.

## Design of the fix
Enable rename only on script/model files
Validate user input filename
Enable delete/add of scripts
Enable model file update
Change all references to model files to be via filename instead of namespace

## Validation of the fix
Manual edge case investigation and test script building to scope out protractor tests

## Automated Tests
New tests added and previous tests updated

title: Pull Request for issue #776 User receives a success message if they cancel the export
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/776 ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [cancel the ongoing export of .bna file from the playground ]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [a check has been put on the size of the downloaded file ]  Design of the fix
 - [Repeating the testcase with fixed solution ]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
If the ongoing  export of .BNA file is canceled from with playground then it gives a success message. A fix has been tried out after removing the success alert. But then a saveAs dialog box is still appearing. Now a check has been put on the size of the downloaded file and a saveAs dialog is shown only if the file has been downloaded else not

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->

1.cancel the ongoing export of .bna file from the playground

- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

Ideally whenever any call is made to other function as 'export', its successful completion should be checked before showing saveAs or any success Alert box

This PR:

 - Moves lost pages for the history of jekyl docs to contributor docs

 - Adds a release process page

title: Add Protractor Base
body:
This PR delivers the base ability to run a Protractor test against Composer Playground.

This is part of #863, though only acts to lay the foundations from which to build and extend Protractor tests (suites).

Once a suitable base set of tests are completed, the test run should be integrated into the build process.

The tests are run via the composer-playground package file via:
 - npm run e2e:main (builds distribution before standing it up on a server as a target for Protractor)
 - npm run e2e:nobuild (does not perform build stage above)

All tests live in composer-playground/e2e/tests

title: Add models directory to import and editor html
body:
#1092 required edits for models director to be placed in the import and editor directory

## Issue/User story
#1092 

## Steps to Reproduce
Import BNA, read the import list of files (look at models coming in ... )

## Design of the fix
Edit html to pre-pend with "models/" Note that this will change with changes inbound relating to file name changing in composer, but at the moment we are being consistent with the way we deal with model files via namespace.

## Validation of the fix
Visual check on multiple browsers

## Automated Tests
To be part of Protractor tests

title: Tidy up subscriptions to event emitters on navigation away from page
body:
Part of #1091

Previous behaviour was to create a new subscription to the same event upon return to page - this was resulting in actioning all subscriber callbacks when an event was emitted. This was resulting in both a memory leak, and the code being executed on out of date information.

## Steps to Reproduce
Detailed within #1091 

## Design of the fix
Cleanup within an ngOnDestroy, that switches a flag used by a "takeWhile" applied to the subscription

## Validation of the fix
Application of best practise clean-up for angular subscribers. Manual testing completed against original scenario, in addition to exploratory testing.

## Automated Tests
Updated existing unit tests.

title: Condition editor define for page re-visit
body:
Within #1091 a page revisit to the Define section was not initialising correctly, this pull request fixes that by:
- calling set page if editor service returns a set file
- ensuring the business network changed callback always works from an updated file list 

## Design of the fix
The page needed to set the current file rather than accept a file retrieved from the editor service, this is because during the file setting, additional flags are applied that indicate if it may be deleted etc.

The business network changed callback needed to ensure that it was running with the most recent file list as it had the potential to use an out of date file list during validation.

## Validation of the fix
Manual test on local build, extension of automated tests to prevent regression.
Pending memory leak tests, and that will be the subject of following PRs

title: Enable namespace changes to model files via composer
body:
Code delivery for #389

## Design of the fix
Namespace change enabled:
- user may change namespace of file
- namespace collision detection will prevent overwriting of existing model files
- new Behaviour subject for file name changes
- invalidation of acl files will be indicated visually and user will not be able to deploy broken BND
- updated add model file and script file logic for new file additions
- added tests for all 

## Validation of the fix
Initial manual testing, supported with automated tests

title: Enable deletion of model and script files
body:
Code delivery for #386, provides the ability for a user to delete model and/or script files

Delivers:
 - new "delete confirmation" modal
 - file validation on file selection
 - if file selected that is already in editor, will not reload
 - validation of all files within business network
 - conditioning of ability to deploy business network based on all BN files being valid
 - test addition for new delivered components
 - test extensions for modified components

## Design of the fix
Follows user flow of named user story.
Modal confirmation enables deletion of named file within business network.
Validation of all business network files enabled and now all files must validate before enabling deploy

## Validation of the fix
manual testing

## Automated Tests
Automated tests established for new additions driving expected component actions.

title: Glossary update and formatting fix!
body:
Updates the glossary to have completed entries (still taking suggestions for more things to go in there btw...) and fixed the formatting errors with codeblocks in ordered lists.

## Checklist
 - [x]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [x]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [x]  Design of the fix
 - [x]  How to prove that the fix works

## Issue/User story

This fixes issue #255 and #804.

## Design of the fix

In order to make code blocks work within ordered lists in markdown, you need to add a blank leading line, then indent the _entire_ codeblock by 8 spaces. The glossary fix has added a whole bunch of terms and explained the existing terms more concisely.

## Validation of the fix

Looks good on my local build.

title: Add missing method for HLFv1 connector and ping in establishment of admin connection
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [x]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [x]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [x]  Design of the fix
 - [x]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [x]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [x]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?

## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
#877 Cannot connect to HLFv1 using playground connection profiles 

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1. Create a HLFv1.0 connection profile
2. Attempt to use HLFv1.0 connection profile
3. Witness errors

## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/hyperledger-composer)
- [ ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
The HLFv1 connector has an abstract list() method which means we cannot determine which business networks have been deployed to the specified Hyperledger Fabric instance. I have implemented it to use the queryInstantiatedChaincodes() function from `fabric-client`.  Handily we can use the `path` property for each instantiated chaincode to test for Composer business networks.

The admin connection code has been extended to ping() the business network on connection, if a business network was specified. Before, for HLFv0.6, we tested the presence of the business network in the connection profile, but since we aren't recording the business network -> chaincode ID mapping anymore this check was not run for HLFv1.0. By using ping(), we can validate that the business network is deployed and running.

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->
Tested locally against both HLFv0.6 and HLFv1.0.

## Automated Tests
<!-- Please describe the automated tests that are put in place to stop this recurring -->
Unit tests added to cover code changes.

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
<!-- JSDocs, WebSite and answers to Stack Overflow questions are possible documentation sources -->

title: Modify noops block timeout for HLF v0.6
body:
By setting the environment variable `CORE_NOOPS_BLOCK_WAIT`, we can reduce the time it takes for a batch to timeout, reducing the time it takes for the system tests to execute.

I'm also removing the prefixes for the `docker-compose.yml` files as the prefixes are not needed - they are namespaced by the parent folders.

title: Big set of docs updates. Name change, content updates for ToC and concepts, bug splats.
body:
## Issue/User story
Issues #492 #607 and #724 are the main ones this hits.

* Adds some conceptual level documents to the top level of the ToC, basic landing pages explaining what the section is and helping guide users to the correct content.
* Updates the ToC for those changes to show now matter what page you're on.
* Removes references to Fabric Composer, replaces most with the correct variable.
* Updates the variable to replace with Hyperledger Composer.
* Changes to make sure we use Rocket.Chat, GitHub, and JavaScript correctly.
* Fixes broken image links in a doc.

title: Documentation Edits
body:
Edits to address final issues for #179 
- Ensured consistency between versions of installed products
- Removed Ubuntu versioning (we only care about condename)
- Extended requirements for Ubuntu Kernel packages
- Added existence of VSCode plugin
- Updated Readme for doc

title: Merge in some updates to the contrib guide
Added checks and tests to solve issue #240
Fix for issue 696
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
 - [x]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
 - [x]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
 - [x]  Design of the fix
 - [x]  How to prove that the fix works
 - [x]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
 - [x]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
Fixes #696 which relates to how we serialize relationships.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Load the attached BNA into Playground
2. Attemp to create an instance of an Order or Vehicle
3.
4.


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [x] [Stack Overflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/fabric-composer)
- [x] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues)
- [x] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/fabric-composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
Relationships are now serialized as URI using the form:
```resource:<namespace>.<type>#<id>```

## Validation of the fix
- Refactored existing tests
- Added new tests to ensure URIs are handled correctly, including when the identifier contains unicode.
- Added a test that creates a Vehicle from the DVLA network and roundtrips it to JSON

## Automated Tests
All tests are automated

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
JSDoc for the new methods: `Relationship.fromURI` and `Identifiable.toJSON` that are responsible for serialization.

title: correct getting started
body: Signed-off-by: Dave Kelsey <d_kelsey@uk.ibm.com>

title: Change sed command in QA doc for better compatibility
body: Use the -i option instead of --in-place as this is a synonym but has better support across different versions of sed; in particular the default sed on MacOS only provides -i and not --in-place.

title: Remove error message on file load and add test to support this oepration
body:
#683 highlights the retaining of an error message across files opened by a user in composer. This fix addressed the persisted (and invalid) error message and includes a test to encapsulate the new behaviour.

## Issue/User story
#683 

## Steps to Reproduce
Open composer
Open a file
Make file invalid and observe error message displayed
Navigate to different file
See persisted error message

## Design of the fix
within loadFile() operation, set error message to null

## Validation of the fix
manual testing

## Automated Tests
Test added to encapsulate operation

title: Fix package edit and add test coverage for fix
body:
Fix required to enable package edit in #683 


## Steps to Reproduce
Open an instance of composer (either on bluemix or local), open a file (LHS)
-> if no ACL present, errors will be shown inthe console

Do above, select edit, select "edit package". This will result in the inability to edit the package.


## Design of the fix
Condition use of acl file during project import
Edit html to enable package edit click action
Edit component file to change logic behind view/navigation operations

## Validation of the fix
Manual testing and extended automated testing

## Automated Tests
Automated testing is included as part of fix

and ensure error message indicates the problem is in a connection profile and why.

title: Use Duktape instead of Otto
body:
🦆 

> quack quack quack

duktape (http://duktape.org) is awesome:

- More modern than Otto (supporting partial ES6/ES7 features)
- A lot faster than Otto (native TypedArray/Buffer support _really_ helps)
- Seems to have lower memory requirements than Otto
- Has CommonJS module loading support, which Otto does not have
- Is written in C and so is a lot more portable to other environments than Otto
- Looks like it is a lot more actively maintained than Otto
- Supports JavaScript regexes, not Golang regexes

go-duktape (https://github.com/olebedev/go-duktape) provides Go bindings to duktape.

In no way is this an alternative to adding native Node.js chaincode support to Hyperledger Fabric and switching to that, however this resolves a lot of performance related problems with using Otto with relatively little fuss.

title: Enable BNA export test
body:
As part of #658 and following an undetected code breakage in the export component, a solution to the enabling of the tests for this component has been provided.

Also changed name of method from "openExportModal" to "exportBNA" since the method doesn't open a modal for user input.

## Design of the fix
Jasmine seems to have a known bug for running tick() inside fakeAsync when the component itself has multiple promises. This means that calling tick() doesn't actually work.

Work around for this was to revert to the Jasmine done() option, and utilise a fixture.whenStable().then( ... ) to check that the required path was traversed. Any failings of the internals of the file creation/save will result in a broken promise chain and a timeout error reported by jasmine, but the promise rejection clearly visible in the test logs. 

## Validation of the fix
Coded test, broke code->test failed, fixed code->test passed

title: fix node_modules being processed in businessNetworkDefinition when package dependencies are symlinked with npm-link
body:
Use of `businessNetworkDefinition.fromDirectory()` was not working when using linked node modules in development, as `*.cto` files from `node_modules` in the linked module (including the test models in `composer-common`) are picked up.

This fix ensures that files within `node_modules` *underneath* toplevel package dependencies are never processed.

I think this is a pretty simple fix but please let me know if any further info is required (:

title: Speed up HLF v1.0 system tests by altering orderer config
body:
Speed up the Hyperledger Fabric v1.0 system tests by altering the orderer configuration.

The orderer batches up transactions for a set period of time before committing them and sending them to the peers. Only when that happens do the block and transaction events get emitted by the peers back to the clients. Composer needs those events in order to know that a transaction has been committed and it is safe to return control to the caller.

I have changed the batch timeout parameter to 250ms down from 10s.

These changes are encoded into the genesis block, so I had to run the `configtxgen` tool:
`configtxgen -profile TwoOrgs -outputBlock twoorgs.orderer.block`
`configtxgen -profile TwoOrgs -channelID mychannel -outputCreateChannelTx mychannel.tx`

title: Make composer more extensible in terms of script languages
body:
The code behaves 'almost' identically to the origin code. What it does is to replace the hard-coded "JS" script type and make the composer more extensible in terms of adding more script languages. The only difference is that it prints a info-level log, instead of throwing an exception when no transaction handler is found in JSTransactionExecutor for the current transaction.

New classes:
 - composer-runtime/lib/languagemanager.js
    This class extracts the language support list from configuration and load it into the runtime.

-  composer-runtime/lib/languagesupport.js
    This class contains all the information needed for a new language support.

 - composer-common/lib/introspect/scriptprocessor.js
    This class is an interface to initialize / parse a script file in a specified script language.

 - composer-common/lib/introspect/jsscriptprocessor.js
    This class is a Javascript implementation of scriptprocessor.

title: Fix transaction submit to hide id/timestamp
body:
## Checklist
 - [ ] #404
 - [ ]  givein in above
 - [ ]  Use a map to hold key/value pairs that are added/removed 
 - [ ]  accept 
 - [ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working

## Issue/User story
issue #404

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1.
2..
4.


## Design of the fix
Used a map to hold parameters that are to be hidden from view. Considered pushing/pulling at areas, but decided that holding parameters in a map would be safer and more extensible.

No longer "stubbing out" a blank transaction, but using the generate instance method - #409 is editing this function to take additional parameters to generate a meaningful empty declaration. A single parameter change will be required here to enable that change once available.

## Validation of the fix
manual testing against all demo cto files

title: Fix async problem when resolving array relations
body: I found a weird problem when trying to have array relation fields and many other relation fields in CTO model. During the execution of a transaction, some of the field would just be left as Relation instead of Resource in the transaction object. I found they will be converted into Resource later asynchronously after the execution of the transaction function. Please see the code diff for details.

body: This increases build times even further, and now applies to all packages since we started using Lerna's "hoist" mode. Also, the docs build seems to be really slow - I think this is down to it using the Trusty container beta, rather than the Trusty VM - moving to the Trusty VM speeds things up.

title: Initial AppVeyor support, use Lerna's "hoist" feature
body:
Wow, many changes, such churn.

- Upgrade to latest version of Lerna.
- Enable "hoist" mode in Lerna which means all packages get installed to a single location.
  - This makes `lerna bootstrap` much quicker as we aren't installing the same thing 10 times!
- Switch from `istanbul` to `nyc` (new istanbul command line).
- Make dependencies the same level where Lerna has identified mismatches.
- Fix JSDoc configuration across all modules, remove public/private docs and ink-docstrap.
- Port vital scripts from shell to JavaScript to support running on Windows.
- Add initial AppVeyor configuration for automated Windows builds.

title: Fix runtime and LoopBack support for HEAD and PUT operations
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the pull request in the Title above -->

## Checklist
[ ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
[ ]  How to recreate the problem without the fix
[ ]  Design of the fix
[ ]  How to prove that the fix works
[ ]  Automated tests that prove the fix keeps on working
[ ]  Documentation - any JSDoc, website, or Stackoverflow answers?


## Issue/User story
<!--- What issue / user story is this for -->
#402 

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug include code to reproduce, if relevant -->
1. Fire up composer-rest-server
2. Submit HEAD request for resource that does not exist
3. Submit PUT request to update a resource that does exist


## Existing issues
<!-- Have you searched for any existing issues or are their any similar issues that you've found? -->
- [ ] [StackOverflow issues](http://stackoverflow.com/tags/fabric-composer)
- [ ] [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/fabric-composer/fabric-composer/issues)
- [ ] [Rocket Chat history](https://chat.hyperledger.org/channel/fabric-composer)

<!-- please include any links to issues here -->

## Design of the fix
<!-- Focus on why you designed this fix this way, and what was discounted. Do not describe just the code - we can read that! -->
HEAD is broken due to runtime code not returning any value for the runtime call existsResourceInRegistry when the resource does not exist. It works OK if the resource exists or if it cannot be accessed. Fixed it so it always returns a value.
PUT requires that we implement the replaceById operation in the LoopBack connector.

## Validation of the fix
<!-- Over and above the tests, what has been done to prove this works? -->
Tested the changes locally.

## Automated Tests
<!-- Please describe the automated tests that are put in place to stop this recurring -->
Added unit tests for changes, and extended system tests to cover exists.

## What documentation has been provided for this pull request
<!-- JSDocs, WebSite and answers to StackOverflow questions are possible documentation sources -->
None required.

title: Documentation Impact section added to issue template
body:
Updating the issue template to include documentation impact, and adding an explanation of expected content in the section, as well as a reminder to add the Docs label if there is any impact. 

## Design of the fix

Adding this section should hopefully make documentation workload tracking easier, and will let me see the landscape a little easier in terms of where to focus efforts.

## Validation of the fix

Posted plans to Rocket.Chat fabric-composer-dev and people seemed reasonably happy with the idea of the change.

title: Removing Concerto references from documentation
body:
Removing all references to Concerto (as far as reasonably possible) and replacing with Composer in preparation for a conref to replace them when the system is set up.

## Checklist
[ ]  A link to the issue/user story that the pull request relates to
[ ]  Design of the fix


## Issue/User story

Previously, lots of references in both codeblocks/snippets and plaintext to Concerto, have replaced with Composer and verified with Matthew White that the ones in codeblocks can be safely changed. There are still a couple of references to concerto, but they're in links to the GitHub repository storing the syntax highlighter for Atom: https://github.ibm.com/Blockchain-WW-Labs/Concerto-Atom


## Design of the fix

Having only references to Composer makes it lots easier to replace these references with conrefs.

## Validation of the fix

Unvalidated as yet, but am working on getting VirtualBox set up so I can run local builds of the documentation.

@mbwhite If you wouldn't mind taking a quick look at the changes, just to verify. I don't want to break anything on my first pull request!

title: Restrict set of REST APIs that are generated
body:
The set of REST APIs that is generated automatically by LoopBack is too extensive and a bit confusing for the majority of our users who are just looking to perform CRUD operations. Additionally, we have not implemented all of the connector methods that are required to support all of the REST APIs, so some of these do not work. This will resolve issue #200.

I have also made some changes to make the startup wait for the business network connection & inspection, so when the port is available the LoopBack server is ready to go.

title: Add initial drop of the playground install guide, bump version to 0.4.4
Stop using Github for initial deploy
body:
The Github integration for samples is very cool, but because we do not authenticate to Github, we run out of our 60 requests/hour per IP very quickly and this is no good for users trying it out for the first time. The Github integration is used to pull down the business network for the initial deploy, so if this fails we end up with an empty business network.

I am re-introducing the hardcoded samples for the initial deploy so that Composer UI will always start up OK. Importantly this will allow Paul to switch his instructions to use our new public Docker images for the final workshop sessions (and it is a great chance to get them tested).

The sample switcher will still use Github integration, and will fail when the rate limit is exceeded. 
Have raised issue #153 to cover that.

title: Get Docker image working on Alpine Linux base
body: The Docker image fails to build as native modules cannot be loaded. This is due to a missing compatibility library in the Alpine Linux base image. Also, I am adding the pm2 process manager to keep the Composer UI server running (incase it crashes).

title: Make Composer UI configurable by runtime environment variables
body:
Currently Composer will create a default connection profile if DOCKER_COMPOSE is set at build time, and the values for that connection profile are hardcoded into the Typescript code. We need to remove that to remove any configuration that must be built into the image.

This is because we want users to be able to configure the default Hyperledger Fabric connection profile(s) without having to build Docker images themselves. They should be able to pull the Docker images from Docker Hub and configure them using environment variables.

This PR introduces a config.json file which can be specified as the value of the COMPOSER_CONFIG environment variable. This configuration file contains a list of default connection profiles to automatically create, and an optional set of credentials to add to the wallet.

title: Automate building of composer-ui image
body:
I have automated the build and push of the Docker image for Composer UI to Docker Hub, so users can easily pull the Docker image instead of needing to grab the source and build it themselves. The Docker image will not be configured to automatically create connection profiles for linked Hyperledger Fabric containers; that will come in a subsequent pull request when we have figured out how to do it nicely without Angular build time environment variables.

I have also fixed up some Concerto -> Composer renames that need to occur in a couple of places.

title: The favicon that everyone has been waiting for is here
Composer Rest Server
body: This is the initial commit of the composer rest server which can be used as a general purpose server that uses the fabric composer loopback connector to connect to a BusinessNetwork, discover the models and then expose a rest API that can be used for application development. More work needs to be done on this.

title: 'Offline' mode for generator and fixes
body:
- Added an 'offline' mode for the Angular2 application generator. The user has an option to provide a business network archive (.bna) file which will then create the application code.
- Added a menu. So, running 'yo fabric-composer' will present the user with a menu where they can either select 'cli' or 'angular'. The user is still able to run 'yo fabric-composer:angular' or 'yo fabric-composer:cli'
- Started to work on Angular2 application generator usage overview document
